0.title: Twitter wins bid to fast-track trial over Musk's $44-bn deal, trial to be held in Oct
0.article_body: Twitter's lawsuit seeking to hold Elon Musk to his $44-billion takeover will go to trial in October, a judge ruled on Tuesday. This comes after Twitter won its motion for an expedited trial in its lawsuit against Musk. Twitter is seeking to enforce Musk's $44-billion acquisition of the company despite the Tesla CEO's intentions to back out of the deal.

1.title: Lyricist Jaani injured in accident in Punjab, pic of his overturned SUV surfaces
1.article_body: Renowned Punjabi lyricist and music composer Jaani Johan was hospitalised after being injured in a road accident in Mohali on Tuesday. As per reports, 33-year-old Jaani and two others were travelling in an SUV which hit another car and both vehicles flipped after the collision. A pic has shown the 'Pachtaoge' and 'Filhall' lyricist's SUV lying overturned on the road.

2.title: Woman sleepwalks through window in Germany, falls from 5th floor
2.article_body: An 18-year-old woman in Germany's Neubrandenburg was left critically injured as she fell onto the street after sleepwalking through an open window. The woman, who fell from fifth floor of the building, was found by a passerby who then called emergency services. The accident took place just after midnight when the victim was sleepwalking in the flat, preliminary probe found.

3.title: 819 armed forces' personnel died by suicide in last 5 years: Govt
3.article_body: As many as 819 armed forces personnel died by suicide in the last five years, Minister of State for Defence Ajay Bhatt has said. Most numbers of suicides were reported in the Army with 642 cases. "For management of stress and suicides in services, the armed forces are continuously evolving measures to improve the stress mitigating mechanisms," Bhatt added.

4.title: Journalists Welfare Fund to be increased by ₹2 crore: U'khand CM
4.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said that Journalists Welfare Fund would be increased by ₹2 crore. The rules of the pension scheme for journalists must be simplified, he said, adding that monthly assistance given to veteran journalists has been increased from ₹5,000 to ₹8,000. Further, ₹36 lakh was approved from the fund for dependents of journalists and seriously ill journalists.

5.title: 7 persons from Sri Lanka reach Tamil Nadu, handed over to police
5.article_body: Seven persons from Sri Lanka were rescued off the coast of Tamil Nadu's Rameswaram by the Indian Coast Guard and handed over to the police on Tuesday. The rescued persons reportedly fled Sri Lanka to escape the ongoing economic crisis on the island nation. They were dropped by boatmen at the shoals near the island of Rameswaram.

6.title: DRDO signed 1,464 ‘transfer of tech’ agreements with firms so far
6.article_body: The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) has inked 1,464 'transfer of technology' agreements to date with Indian companies, MoS Defence Ajay Bhatt has said. The DRDO is working towards self-reliance in the defence sector, he said. The minister also said the government is looking to collaborate with a foreign engine company for the co-production of combat jet engines.

7.title: Putin arrives in Tehran for summit with Iranian, Turkish Presidents
7.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin arrived in Tehran on Tuesday where he will hold talks with his Iranian counterpart Ebrahim Raisi and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan. According to media reports, the trilateral summit will majorly focus on the current situation in Syria. Putin and Erdogan will also deliberate on the issue of Ukrainian grain exports through the Black Sea.

8.title: Russia will set the terms for peace in Ukraine: Medvedev
8.article_body: Deputy Chairman of the Security Council of Russia Dmitry Medvedev on Tuesday said that peace will be established in Ukraine on Moscow's terms. Speaking about the conflict in eastern Europe, he also said, "Russia will achieve all its goals." Earlier, Medvedev had said that NATO and Ukraine's refusal to identify Crimea as part of Russia poses a "systemic threat".

9.title: Covered ourselves with hair after removing bra: Aspirant at Kerala NEET centre
9.article_body: A medical aspirant, one of the many allegedly forced to remove her bra at Kollam NEET exam centre, said, "While writing the exams, we had gone through mental trauma." "We had to cover ourselves with our hair as we didn't have a dupatta and we had to sit with male aspirants which too was indeed a harrowing experience," she added.

10.title: IIT-K incubated startup EndureAir Systems raises $1.7 mn in funding
10.article_body: EndureAir Systems, an IIT Kanpur incubated drone startup, said that it has raised $1.7 million in seed funding from Jalaj Dani, co-promoter of Asian Paints and founders of robotics and automation company Addverb Technologies. The drone startup, was founded in 2019 by IIT Kanpur professors Abhishek and Mangal Kothari, along with their students, Rama Krishna and Chirag Jain.

11.title: Girls were instructed to carry bras in hand on return: Aspirant at Kerala NEET centre
11.article_body: A medical aspirant, one of the many allegedly forced to remove her bra at Kollam NEET exam centre, said, "We were [told]...there'll be scanning...I was asked if I had a hook attached to my inner-wear." "What was even more concerning is that the official...instructed...girls to carry the inner-wear in their hands while returning and not wear it," the aspirant added.

12.title: I feel you had a lot more ODI fuel left, retired too soon: Yuvraj to Stokes
12.article_body: Conveying his best wishes to England all-rounder Ben Stokes following his announcement of ODI retirement, Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Well done on a fabulous ODI career Stokes! A world-class all-rounder who's an asset for any side. Retired too soon!" He added, "I feel you had a lot more ODI fuel left in you." Stokes is playing in his last ODI today.

13.title: Neobanking startup Niyo raises $30 mn from private equity firm Multiples
13.article_body: Neobanking startup Niyo has raised $30 million from private equity firm Multiples Alternate Asset Management. The company raised $100 million in its Series C funding round in February 2022, led by Accel and Lightrock India. Niyo, founded in 2015 by Virender Bisht and Vinay Bagri, offers banking services in partnership with banks such as Yes Bank, ICICI Bank, among others.

14.title: Samyukta Kisan Morcha rejects govt's MSP committee
14.article_body: The Samyukta Kisan Morcha has rejected the government's committee on Minimum Support Price (MSP). The SKM objected to the presence of some members in the MSP committee, saying they had supported the three contentious farm laws repealed last year. Prime Minister Narendra Modi had repealed the farm laws and promised to form a committee to discuss a legal MSP guarantee.

15.title: Spanish man burnt by wildfire while trying to save town, critical
15.article_body: A man whose clothes caught fire amid a wildfire in Spain's Tabara on Monday has been admitted to the hospital and is critical. The man, Angel Martin Arjona, was trying to dig a trench in a field to stop the approaching fire from reaching his town when the blaze engulfed him. Arjona, who suffered severe burns, was airlifted to hospital.

16.title: 3 women who told girls to remove bras before NEET among 5 detained in Kerala
16.article_body: Kerala Police on Tuesday took five women into custody over complaints of girls being asked to remove their bras before appearing for the NEET medical entrance exam in Kollam. Three of the women were associated with the external agency deputed to frisk students at the exam centre, police said. Two women are staffers of the institute where NEET was held.

17.title: Mamata's nephew came to vote in Prez polls with convoy of cars: MLA
17.article_body: BJP MLA Sudip Mukherjee filed a complaint with Election Commission against West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew, Abhishek Banerjee. Mukherjee claimed MP Abhishek brought a convoy of cars inside West Bengal Assembly premises when he came to vote in Presidential polls. According to rules of Presidential elections, MLAs/MPs can enter Assembly only with a car and a driver, Mukherjee said.

18.title: 37-year-old woman killed by a leopard in Uttarakhand's Pauri
18.article_body: A 37-year-old woman, Rina Devi, was killed by a leopard in Uttarakhand's Pauri district on Tuesday, officials said. Rina Devi was attacked while she was returning after dropping her son at his school in a nearby village, District Forest Officer Dinkar Tewari said. The woman's body was recovered from nearby bushes by the forest department, the official added.

19.title: Team India head coach Rahul Dravid features in Shikhar Dhawan's viral reel, fans react
19.article_body: Shikhar Dhawan, who'll lead India in ODI series against West Indies, shared a reel on Instagram which featured Team India head coach Rahul Dravid. Reacting to the viral reel, a fan wrote, "Dravid sir at end...These gen guys making him look so different." Another fan wrote, "Never thought we could ever see Rahul Dravid in a reel."

20.title: Man burnt alive by burglars in Bihar for resisting robbery attempt
20.article_body: A 34-year-old man was burnt alive by a group of unidentified persons for resisting a robbery attempt in Bihar's Munger. After being set on fire, the man ran into Munger's Dasharathpur railway station. Station officials and Railway Protection Force personnel took the victim to the hospital where he died during treatment. He is survived by his wife and two children.

21.title: Sri Lankan lawmakers to elect new President tomorrow
21.article_body: Sri Lankan lawmakers will elect the country's new President tomorrow (July 20). The candidates are Acting President Ranil Wickremesinghe, Sinhala Buddhist nationalist Dullas Alahapperuma and leftist leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake. Last week, Gotabaya Rajapaksa vacated the President's office, following public protests against his government's alleged mismanagement of the economy.

22.title: Fires erupt across UK as it records its hottest day ever, pics surface
22.article_body: The south of England and Wales saw multiple fires on Tuesday as temperatures in the UK breached the 40 degrees Celsius mark for the first time ever. London Fire Brigade declared a major incident as wildfires spread in several locations with houses going up in flames in some areas. Pictures showed huge plumes of smoke rising from homes and parks.

23.title: We are not cars where you can fill us up with petrol: Ben Stokes on ODI retirement
23.article_body: Talking about his decision to retire from ODIs, England Test captain Ben Stokes said, "We’re not cars where you can fill us up with petrol." The 31-year-old all-rounder added, "The schedule is jam-packed, and you’re asking a lot of the players to keep putting in 100% of their efforts every time you walk onto the field for your country."

24.title: Told him I wanted a CSK jersey not Team India one: Pakistan's Haris Rauf on meeting Dhoni
24.article_body: Recalling meeting MS Dhoni during the T20 World Cup 2021, Pakistan pacer Haris Rauf said, "I asked him to give me one of his shirts but I told him...I wanted a CSK jersey and not the Team India one." Rauf added, "He told me he'll surely send me that. I finally received it when I was in Australia."

25.title: Cong coming to power important than me becoming CM: DK Shivakumar
25.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar on Tuesday said that Congress coming to power is more important than him becoming the Chief Minister of Karnataka. "Only if the Congress party comes to power, the post of Chief Minister will be available," DK Shivakumar said. "The party high command will decide who should be the CM candidate," he added.

26.title: Stokes cares about everyone in England's dressing room: Teammate Wood
26.article_body: England pacer Mark Wood said teammate Ben Stokes, who announced his retirement from ODI cricket, is a "natural leader" and will be a big miss for the team. "Stokes is an alpha guy but he cares about everyone in that dressing room...wants to make sure that they are alright," he added. Stokes made his ODI debut in August 2011.

27.title: Albania, North Macedonia begin membership talks with EU
27.article_body: Albania and North Macedonia on Tuesday began talks with the European Union for membership. The EU's Executive Commission in 2018 had recommended membership negotiations start, but Germany, the Netherlands, France and finally Bulgaria held up the process with different demands. Albania and North Macedonia, which are NATO members, have received criticism for taking in migrants from outside the bloc.

28.title: 24-year-old man arrested with country-made pistol in Jammu
28.article_body: The police arrested a 24-year-old man with a country-made pistol in Jammu on Tuesday, officials said. The pistol was recovered from the man, named Akshay Kumar, during a routine check. Kumar runs a drug rehabilitation centre at Jammu's Gharota village in the name of Ayodhya foundation, the officials said.

29.title: Woman lynched in WB for alleged illicit relation with son-in-law
29.article_body: A 35-year-old woman was allegedly lynched by a mob in a village in West Bengal's Murshidabad district early on Tuesday for having an illicit relationship with her son-in-law, police said. The woman's 33-year-old son-in-law was also beaten up. Villagers had warned the man not to visit his mother-in-law when her husband was away for work.

30.title: ED arrests Jharkhand CM Soren's political aide in money laundering case
30.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren's political aide Pankaj Mishra was arrested by Enforcement Directorate on Tuesday in connection with an alleged money laundering case related to illegal mining. Mishra was taken to a Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) court. ED had earlier said that it had seized ₹11.88 crore lying in 37 bank accounts belonging to Mishra and others.

31.title: I bought a third-hand car for ₹60,000 after first few films: Kartik Aaryan
31.article_body: Kartik Aaryan has said when he first joined Bollywood, he didn't have any car. "The first car...I bought was after a couple of films, a third-hand car...for around ₹60,000," he stated. "I took it specifically because I was still taking an auto to the red carpet, or going on a bike, or getting a lift," he added.

32.title: Healthcare startup PharmEasy plans $200 mn fundraising: Report
32.article_body: PharmEasy, a healthcare startup that provides medicines and medical services on its platform, is currently in talks with investors to raise $200 million but at a valuation 15%-25% lower than last year's $5.1 billion, according to reports. This could reduce PharmEasy's valuation for the funding round to $3.8 billion. Further, the company's IPO, targeted for this year, has been delayed.

33.title: Thank you: Shriver on Russia's Daria Kasatkina coming out as gay
33.article_body: After Russia's top-ranked singles player Daria Kasatkina came out as gay in a video interview posted online on Monday, former women's doubles world number one Pam Shriver took to Twitter and wrote, "Thank you!" World number 12 Kasatkina said she is dating Olympic medallist figure skater Natalia Zabiiako. Meanwhile, Kasatkina lost in first round of Hamburg European Open on Sunday.

34.title: 3 missing, 11 injured after gas explosion in China's Tianjin
34.article_body: At least 11 people were wounded and three were reported missing after a gas explosion in an apartment building in the Chinese city of Tianjin on Tuesday. The explosion took place during the early morning hours, Xinhua reported citing local authorities. The victims sustained non-life-threatening injuries, the local government said.

35.title: Met injured visa officer in Sri Lanka: Indian High Commission
35.article_body: Indian High Commission officials in Sri Lanka on Tuesday visited the Director of Indian Visa Centre Vivek Varma who sustained "grievous injuries" during an "unprovoked assault" on Monday night. According to the High Commission, the alleged assault took place near the capital city of Colombo. Local authorities have been informed about the matter, the High Commission added.

36.title: Acclaimed Iranian filmmaker jailed for 'anti-govt propaganda'
36.article_body: Acclaimed Iranian filmmaker Jafar Panahi has been ordered to serve a full six-year prison sentence, which was given to him in 2010 for 'anti-government propaganda'. Panahi was arrested earlier this month after he went to the prosecutor's office to enquire about his colleagues, who were also arrested by authorities amid a government crackdown. Panahi's films have won several international awards.

37.title: Hangzhou Asian Games, delayed due to COVID, rescheduled for September 2023
37.article_body: The postponed Asian Games will be held from September 23 to October 8 2023 in Hangzhou, the Olympic Council of Asia (OCA) announced on Tuesday. The Games could not be hosted this year because of rising COVID-19 cases in China. The 19th Asian Games were originally planned to be held in Hangzhou from September 10-25 this year.

38.title: Govt shouldn't give security to those speaking against religion: BJP
38.article_body: BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh on Tuesday said that some people make incorrect statements on religion and the country only to get security and urged the government to not give them any protection. He also said that suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma shouldn't get security just because she's a member of the ruling party.

39.title: 2-year-old boy drowns in a swimming pool in Lonavala, dies
39.article_body: Police said a two-year-old boy drowned in the swimming pool of a bungalow in Maharashtra's Lonavala, where his family had gathered to celebrate his second birthday. The incident took place on July 13 at the bungalow which the Nashik-based family had booked. "The parents...were busy on the first floor...when the toddler fell in the swimming pool," an official said.

40.title: ED arrests ex-Mumbai Police chief Sanjay Pandey in NSE phone tapping case
40.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday arrested former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey in connection with a money laundering case linked to the alleged illegal phone tapping of National Stock Exchange (NSE) employees. The 1986-batch IPS officer retired from service on June 30. He has also served as the acting Maharashtra director general of police.

41.title: New pic taken by world's most powerful telescope shows purple galactic swirl in universe
41.article_body: A new picture taken by the world's most powerful telescope, the James Webb Space Telescope, shows a purple galactic swirl in the universe. The image is of the centre of the spiral galaxy NGC 628. The image is a composite of three sets of data at different wavelengths taken by JWST’s mid-infrared instrument team.

42.title: Man dies by suicide after killing same-sex partner in MP's Betul
42.article_body: A 32-year-old man strangulated his partner to death before dying by suicide in MP's Betul when the latter threatened him of disclosing their homosexual relationship, police said on Tuesday. The accused's body was found on Saturday and his partner's body was recovered three days later, police added. The murder victim was in a relationship with other men, the probe found.

43.title: Rajasthan gangster wanted in 35 criminal cases held by Gujarat ATS
43.article_body: A Rajasthan-based gangster, Arvind Singh Bika, who was wanted in 35 criminal cases including murder, rioting and looting across three states was arrested by the Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS). Two pistols and live ammunition were recovered from him, police said. "He was often seen posting threatening videos on social media with him posing with weapons," an ATS official said.

44.title: Kalam was true representation of Indo-Islamic culture: Prez Kovind
44.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday said former President APJ Abdul Kalam was an ideal representation of Indo-Islamic culture. "He (Kalam) used to specially meet school children. He was sure that future generations will form the golden future of the country," President Kovind said. "I also believe that girls will have an important role in the country's development," he added.

45.title: Monkeypox testing has started at NIV Alappuzha: Kerala Minister
45.article_body: Kerala Health Minister Veena George on Tuesday said that the state has started monkeypox testing at National Institute of Virology (NIV) Alappuzha. "Kits have been brought to NIV Alappuzha from Pune...Testing samples in Kerala will reduce the time duration to get the result," Veena George said. This comes after Kerala confirmed the second case of monkeypox on Monday.

46.title: Red alert for heavy rain issued in 7 U'khand districts for tomorrow
46.article_body: India Meteorological Department has issued a red alert for heavy rain in Dehradun, Tehri, Pauri, Nainital, Champawat, Udham Singh Nagar and Haridwar for Wednesday. The heavy rainfall could trigger more landslides in sensitive areas of the state. Travellers have been advised to avoid unnecessary journeys. CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said the disaster management authorities are on alert.

47.title: Sunak among final 3 contenders for UK PM, wins most support in latest voting round
47.article_body: Former British Chancellor Rishi Sunak is among the final three contenders for the post of British PM after lawmaker Kemi Badenoch was eliminated in the latest round of voting. Sunak won the most support from Conservative Party members of the British Parliament. Trade Minister Penny Mordaunt and Foreign Secretary Liz Truss are the other two candidates still in the race.

48.title: Rebel Sena MP is party's leader in Lok Sabha, says Maha CM Shinde
48.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has recognised rebel Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale as the party's floor leader in the Lower House of Parliament. "Shiv Sena MPs too have supported us in our stand to uphold ideals of Balasaheb Thackeray," Shinde added, while speaking to mediapersons in Delhi.

49.title: Failure of entire govt machinery: Kejriwal on killing of Haryana DSP
49.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said the killing of a DSP in Haryana was the result of the failure of the entire government machinery in the state. "How will the public be safe where the police is not safe?" he asked. The DSP investigating illegal stone-mining was killed on Tuesday when a truck drove into him, officials said.

50.title: PIL seeking my removal filed out of vendetta & vengeance: CBI chief
50.article_body: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) chief Subodh Jaiswal has told Bombay HC that public interest litigation (PIL) seeking his removal from the post has been filed out of "vendetta" and "vengeance". The PIL, which was filed by a retired police officer, stated that Jaiswal has doubtful credibility. Notably, the petitioner had also challenged Jaiswal's previous appointment as Maharashtra DGP.

51.title: Hindustan Unilever's net profit rises 14% YoY to ₹2,391 cr in Q1
51.article_body: Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL) on Tuesday reported a 13.85% YoY rise in its consolidated net profit to ₹2,391 crore for the March-June quarter. Its standalone net profit was at ₹2,191 crore. HUL's revenue from operations rose 19.46% YoY to ₹14,331 crore while its earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortisation (EBITDA) margin was at 23.2% in Q1 FY23.

52.title: Qatar's Barshim wins 3rd straight high jump gold at World Championships
52.article_body: Tokyo Olympics gold medallist Mutaz Barshim of Qatar jumped a world-leading 2.37 metres to win high jump gold medal for the third successive time at World Athletics Championships in Oregon on Monday. South Korea's Sanghyeok Woo took silver (2.35 metres), while Ukraine's Andriy Protsenko won bronze (2.33 metres). Notably, 31-year-old Barshim went beyond his own season's best of 2.30 metres.

53.title: K'taka officials isolate co-passengers of India's 2nd monkeypox patient
53.article_body: Authorities in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada district have isolated co-passengers of India's second monkeypox patient. The 31-year-old man from Kannur arrived at Mangalore International Airport (MIA) from Dubai on July 13. The District Surveillance Officer said as many as 191 passengers were in the aircraft along with him and 11 of them were from Dakshina Kannada.

54.title: Farmer files complaint against Lord Indra over lack of rains in UP, pic goes viral
54.article_body: A UP farmer submitted a written complaint to the local administration against the Hindu God of rain "Indra Devta (Bhagwan ji)", citing a lack of rainfall. A picture of the complaint filed by Sumit Kumar Yadav has gone viral. He wrote, "All are suffering...I, therefore, request you (District Magistrate) to take action against Indra Bhagwan."

55.title: I retired from ODIs due to horrendous schedule, ECB banned me from T20Is too: Pietersen
55.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen took to Twitter to take a dig at the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB). "I once said the schedule was horrendous and I couldn’t cope, so I retired from ODI cricket & the ECB banned me from [T20Is] too," he tweeted. Pietersen's tweet comes after England Test captain Ben Stokes announced his retirement from ODIs.

56.title: Part of world's most powerful telescope permanently damaged by space rock: Report
56.article_body: Scientists have said part of James Webb Space Telescope, the world's most powerful telescope, suffered permanent damage due to a series of micrometeorite strikes. The micrometeoroid which hit a segment in the period May 22-24 caused significant uncorrectable change in the overall figure of that segment, said scientists. The telescope was built at a cost of $10 billion.

57.title: Govt releases list of cities and towns renamed in the last 5 years
57.article_body: The Centre gave its nod for renaming seven cities and towns, including Allahabad to Prayagraj, in last five years, the Lok Sabha was informed. The approval was given to renaming of Rajahmundry (Rajamahendravaram), Nagar Untari (Shri Banshidhar Nagar), Birsinghpur Pali (Maa Birasini Dham), Hoshangabad Nagar (Narmadapuram), Babai (Makhan Nagar) and Shri Hargobindpur city (Shri Hargobindpur Sahib).

58.title: India on course to achieve 8-8.5% growth based on Q1 data: Govt
58.article_body: India is on course to achieve projected 8-8.5% growth based on high frequency indicators for the first quarter of FY23, the Finance Ministry said on Tuesday. Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said the government has cut excise duty on petrol and diesel and special excise duty/cess on petrol, diesel and jet fuel exports to ensure continued growth momentum.

59.title: Huge sinkhole opens up in New York City, swallows van; video goes viral
59.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a huge sinkhole opening up in New York City. In the video, a van can be seen toppling into the sinkhole after heavy rains pounded the area. No injuries were reported in connection with the sinkhole, officials said. As per reports, 75 customers were left without water service because of the sinkhole.

60.title: Canada temple issues security measures after Gandhi statue defaced
60.article_body: The management of the Vishnu temple in Canada's Toronto has issued new security measures after a statue of Mahatma Gandhi situated there was defaced last week. Additional security cameras will be installed near the temple complex to monitor the surroundings, an official said. India had released a statement on the statue's desecration, terming the incident as a "hate crime".

61.title: Man stabs wife, her live-in partner to death in Bhopal; arrested
61.article_body: A man, Sunil Malviya, was arrested for stabbing his wife and her live-in partner to death in a market in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal. Station in-charge Alok Srivastava said the victim, 22-year-old Aruna Malviya, was living separately with her 5-year-old daughter and 25-year-old Rajendra. Sunil tracked the timing of their return and attacked them on Monday evening, police added.

62.title: Police arrest 682 criminals under Operation Akraman in Haryana
62.article_body: Haryana Police arrested 682 criminals including proclaimed offenders, bail jumpers and confiscated illicit arms, liquor and narcotic substances under a special drive called Operation Akraman. DGP PK Agrawal said about 5,000 personnel in 616 teams raided locations following tip-offs. The aim was to check smuggling of weapons and eradicate drug menace in the state, police added.

63.title: Situation is exceptional but comparing it with India is ignorant: Jaishankar on Lanka
63.article_body: The government hosted an all-party meeting on Sri Lanka crisis on Tuesday, during which External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar briefed the attendees, including opposition MPs. "The situation is unprecedented and India is worried about it. But drawing comparisons (with India) is uninformed," said Jaishankar. The opposition has raised concerns about India's economy in the wake of Lankan crisis.

64.title: Russia seeks explanation from India over detained cargo ship in Cochin
64.article_body: Russian Embassy in India has said it's aware of the Russian cargo ship detention in Cochin, on board which military cargo for Indian Armed Forces was delivered. The embassy has filed an official request for an explanation of the incident's circumstances. "We've also asked...MEA to ensure unconditional observance of...rights of...Russian shipowners and crew," it said.

65.title: State taking all precautions against monkeypox: TN Health Minister
65.article_body: Tamil Nadu Health Minister Ma Subramanian said the state is taking all precautions to prevent the spread of monkeypox and is monitoring those coming from abroad at four international airports in the state. Wards and sufficient number of beds have been allocated to deal with any possible cases of monkeypox that may be reported in the coming days, Subramanian added.

66.title: KCR dedicated to eradicating poverty in Telangana: Minister
66.article_body: Telangana Minority Welfare Minister Koppula Eshwar said CM K Chandrashekar Rao is dedicated to eradicating poverty among minorities in the state. A number of gurukuls are being started in English medium to provide high-quality education, he added. "Earlier...subsidies [for minorities] were only 20 to 30%, but after the formation of Telangana, KCR increased them to 60 to 95%," Eshwar said.

67.title: 22 killed, 33 injured as bus hits truck in south Egypt
67.article_body: At least 22 people were killed and 33 people were injured when a passenger bus hit a trailer truck in southern Egypt's Minya province on Tuesday. The trailer truck's tire was being changed on the roadside of a highway which links Egypt's capital Cairo to the country's south when the accident occurred. The passenger bus was going to Cairo.

68.title: Check-in using face recognition at Bengaluru airport from Aug 15
68.article_body: The first phase of Centre's Digi Yatra project, which allows passengers to check in at airport using facial recognition technology, will commence at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport on August 15. Under the project, passengers will pass through check-points through a contactless process, using facial features to establish their identities, which would be linked to boarding passes.

69.title: India & China to maintain stability along LAC after 16th round of talks
69.article_body: India and China agreed to maintain stability on ground and resolve relevant issues pertaining to Line of Actual Control (LAC) in 16th round of corps commander-level talks held on Sunday. In a joint press release, both sides reaffirmed that resolution of remaining issues would enable progress in bilateral ties. Talks were held at Chushul-Moldo border meeting point on Indian side.

70.title: K'taka family announces ₹50,000 reward for finding missing parrot
70.article_body: A family that rears parrots at home in Karnataka's Tumakuru has announced that anybody who returns their missing parrot or gives information about it will be given ₹50,000 as reward. Animal activist Ravi, who owns the African grey parrot, said 'Rustuma' has been missing since Saturday from Jayanagar locality. "By mistake, it has flown away...It cannot go far," Ravi added.

71.title: I don't think I am the best player right now: World no. 6 Alcaraz
71.article_body: World number six Carlos Alcaraz said he doesn't think that he's the best player currently. "I mean, Novak Djokovic won Wimbledon, Rafael Nadal [won] Roland-Garros and Australian Open, so there are a lot of great players ahead of me right now," he added. The 19-year-old Spaniard has won four ATP titles this year, including two Masters 1000s.

72.title: Estonia's new government headed by PM Kaja Kallas sworn in
72.article_body: Estonia's new government has been sworn in, giving Prime Minister Kaja Kallas a ruling majority. Last week, Kallas resigned after the previous coalition government was disbanded over ally Centre Party's opposition to the government's reform of primary education. The new government will last till the elections in March 2023.

73.title: 1 accused in Haryana DSP's killing arrested; was shot in leg in encounter
73.article_body: One person involved in the killing of Tauru DSP Surender Singh in Haryana's Nuh has been arrested, Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij has confirmed. According to police, the accused was arrested after an encounter, during which he was shot in the leg. "Other [accused] will be arrested soon...We're very serious as the attack has happened on our police," Vij added.

74.title: Mumbai airport sees 132% growth in passenger traffic in 6 months
74.article_body: Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport has seen a 132% increase in passenger traffic in the first six months of 2022, compared to the first six months of 2021, reports said. Around 1.30 lakh flight movements were recorded across domestic and international destinations and 1.336 crore domestic passengers travelled via 97,460 flights. May was the best month for air travel.

75.title: Srinagar makes masks compulsory at public places as COVID cases rise
75.article_body: The district administration in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Tuesday made use of face masks compulsory at all public places with immediate effect because of a spike in COVID-19 cases. The rule will be in place till further orders. All district and sectoral officers have been asked to ensure the usage of face masks by all officials in the office.

76.title: Udhayakumar elected as Deputy Leader of Opposition in TN Assembly
76.article_body: AIADMK has elected MLA RB Udhayakumar as Deputy Leader of the Opposition in Tamil Nadu Legislative Assembly. The post was earlier held by former Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam, who was expelled from the party earlier this month. Further, MLA SS Krishnamurthy has replaced Manoj Pandian as AIADMK's Deputy Secretary. Earlier, Pandian was expelled from the party for supporting Panneerselvam.

77.title: Nearly 30,000 recruited in J&K's public sector since 2019: Govt
77.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir administration has recruited nearly 30,000 people in the public sector since 2019, Union Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai said in Lok Sabha on Tuesday. Rai added that 5.2 lakh people were employed through the self-employment schemes from August 2019 to June 2022. In August 2019, Jammu and Kashmir's special status was scrapped.

78.title: Distance criteria for EWS admissions in Delhi pvt schools changed to 3 km
78.article_body: Economically Weaker Section (EWS) students seeking admissions in Delhi's private schools will be able to choose an institution within 3 kms (instead of the earlier 1 km) of their residence, the Directorate of Education said. In a computerised draw of lots, students in a 1-km radius are selected and chances of those residing 3 kms away get minimised, officials said.

79.title: Dog-like robot with a virtual spinal cord learns to walk in 1 hour; video released
79.article_body: A dog-like robot with a "virtual spinal cord" has learned to walk from scratch in just one hour, researchers from Germany's Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems claimed. The robot, named Morti, features reflexes just like an animal and learns from its mistakes. It continuously compares sent and expected sensor information, runs reflex loops, and adapts its motor control patterns.

80.title: I painted his face but was still recognised: Ex-Barcelona player on Ronaldo
80.article_body: Former Barcelona player Boudewijn Zenden revealed an interesting story of his teammate and Brazilian footballer, Ronaldo Nazario, when the latter had recently won the 1994 FIFA World Cup. "I took Ronaldo to...the best yearly carnival [of] the Netherlands...He wore a clown outfit...and I painted his face, but people still recognised him. His smile...revealed his true identity," Zenden said.

81.title: Hottest day recorded in history of UK as temperatures cross 40°C for 1st time
81.article_body: The hottest day has been recorded in the history of UK as temperatures hit 40.2°C at London Heathrow Airport on Tuesday. The previous hottest day in UK (38.7°C) was recorded in Cambridge University Botanic Garden on July 25, 2019. Many sites across UK surpassed the 2019 record today. Charlwood recorded temperatures of 39.9°C, while temperatures reached 39.6°C in Kew Gardens.

82.title: Hyderabad reported zero bad air days from 2019-21: Govt
82.article_body: Hyderabad reported zero bad air days from 2019 to 2021, as per a parliamentary report from the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change. Hyderabad's air quality index (AQI) was below 200 during this period. Visakhapatnam saw 25 bad air days in 2019, 23 in 2020 and 21 in 2021.

83.title: 12,611 enemy properties left behind by Pakistani, Chinese citizens
83.article_body: A total of 12,611 enemy properties were left behind by people who have taken citizenship of Pakistan and China, the Lok Sabha was informed on Tuesday. Union Minister of State for Home Ajay Kumar Mishra said out of the 12,611 properties, 12,485 were related to Pakistani nationals and 126 to Chinese citizens.

84.title: 4 men arrested for offering namaz at Lulu mall in Uttar Pradesh
84.article_body: Four men were arrested by the Uttar Pradesh Police on Tuesday, days after a video of them allegedly offering namaz at Lulu mall in Lucknow surfaced online. The accused were identified after checking surveillance footage from the mall, police said. The arrests came following demands of several Hindu right wing groups seeking permission to recite Hanuman Chalisa in the mall.

85.title: Brazilian Amazon lost 18 trees per second in 2021: Report
85.article_body: According to a report by Mapbiomas, deforestation in the Brazilian Amazon increased by more than 20% in 2021 and the rainforest faced deforestation at a rate of 18 trees per second. The report added that Brazil lost 42,000 square kilometres of tree cover in the last three years, a landmass equivalent to the area of the Rio de Janeiro state.

86.title: Baby-sized fibroid removed from 38-yr-old woman's uterus in Pune
86.article_body: A 5.6 kg fibroid, equivalent to the size of a full-term baby, was removed surgically from the uterus of a 38-year-old woman in Pune. "On arrival, we found that [the patient]...had a history of...abnormally heavy...bleeding and anaemia for a year," a doctor said. The patient, who was operated upon for two hours, was discharged 50 hours after her surgery.

87.title: Eka Care, platform which digitises medical records, raises $15 mn
87.article_body: Healthtech startup Eka Care, which helps digitise the medical records of Indian patients, has raised $15 million in its Series A round. The round, led by Hummingbird Ventures, saw participation from 3one4 Capital, Mirae Assets, Verlinvest, Aditya Birla Ventures, among others. Founded in 2020 by Vikalp Sahni and Deepak Tuli, the platform has over 30 million users and 5,000 doctors.

88.title: Artisan marketplace Lal10 raises $5.5 mn in pre-Series A round
88.article_body: Lal10, a cross-border marketplace for Indian artisans, raised $5.5 million in its pre-Series A funding round. The round, led by Yuj Ventures and Beyond Capital Ventures, saw participation from Spiral Ventures, Singularity Ventures, Asymmetry Ventures among others, and some prominent angels. Founded in 2017 by Maneet Gohil, Sanchit Govil and Albin Jose, the firm caters to grassroots MSMEs in India.

89.title: 90% road repair work completed in 3 days: Pune civic body
89.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) on Tuesday claimed that it has completed around 90% work to repair potholes in the city in just three days from July 15 to 18. PMC filled 848 potholes, repaired 65 chamber lids in this period, Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said. However, citizens living near the affected areas still complain about the poor condition of roads.

90.title: Cancel arms deal with Taiwan immediately: China to US
90.article_body: China has sought an immediate cancellation of the latest arms deal between the US and Taiwan, Chinese state media reported on Monday citing the country's Defence Ministry. On Friday, the Pentagon said that the US Department of State had given its nod for the potential sale of military technical assistance worth an estimated $108 million to Taiwan.

91.title: Commerce enablement firm AnyMind Group raises $29.4 mn in funding
91.article_body: AnyMind Group, an end-to-end commerce enablement company, has raised $29.4 million in a Series D funding round. Additionally, the company has also secured a $7.2 million credit facility from Japan-based corporate banking unit Mizuho Bank. So far, the brand support platform has acquired seven companies from various countries including Japan, Hong Kong, Thailand and India.

92.title: Filmmaker Avinash Das detained for sharing pic of Amit Shah with jailed IAS officer Pooja
92.article_body: Filmmaker Avinash Das was detained on Tuesday afternoon outside his Mumbai residence by a team of Gujarat Police. He was detained in connection with a case where he shared a photo on social media of Home Minister Amit Shah with arrested IAS officer Pooja Singhal. He is being brought to Ahmedabad for further action, an official said.

93.title: DCW issues notice after woman gives birth outside Safdarjung Hospital
93.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women has issued a notice to Safdarjung Hospital's Medical Superintendent after a woman gave birth on the floor outside the building of the hospital. The woman's family alleged that she was denied a maternity ward. However, a hospital spokesperson said that they did not deny the woman permission, adding that there was a lapse in communication.

94.title: Man detained for trying to chop off minor boy's ears in Assam
94.article_body: Police have detained a man in Assam's Tinsukia district for allegedly trying to chop off the ears of a minor boy who was reportedly in a relationship with his daughter. "Nearly half of both his ears were cut," said a staffer of the nursing home treating the victim. According to police, the boy was "mercilessly" beaten before the attempted mutilation.

95.title: Hardik a changed man now, I see sense of ambition in him: Manjrekar
95.article_body: Talking about Hardik Pandya, Sanjay Manjrekar said the India all-rounder is a changed man now. "I see a sense of ambition coming into him. And once you have that, wanting to grow within Indian cricket then there's tremendous motivation," he added. Hardik was adjudged 'Player of the Series' in India's 2-1 win in three-match ODI series against England.

96.title: Over 1,500 people killed in elephant attacks in last 3 years: Govt
96.article_body: About 1,578 people have died in elephant attacks in the country in the last three years, according to data shared by the Union Environment Ministry in Lok Sabha. Out of the total deaths reported due to elephant attacks, 585 people died in 16 states during 2019-20, 461 fatalities occurred in 2020-21 and 532 people died in 2021-22, the ministry added.

97.title: Tamil Nadu govt transfers Kallakurichi Collector, SP after violence over girl's death
97.article_body: Tamil Nadu government on Tuesday transferred Kallakurichi District Collector PN Sridhar and Superintendent of Police (SP) S Selvakumar, days after violence broke out following a Class 12 girl's death. Sravan Kumar Jatavath has been posted as the new collector and P Pakalavan will take charge as the SP. The state has formed a Special Investigation Team to probe the violence.

98.title: Govt lists countries preferred by people who gave up Indian citizenship in 2021
98.article_body: Over 1.6 lakh people gave up Indian citizenship in 2021, the Union Ministry of Home Affairs' data released on Tuesday said. The US was the most-preferred country by such people, followed by Australia, Canada and the UK. Italy, New Zealand, Singapore, Germany, the Netherlands and Sweden were also among the top 10 nations where expats renounced Indian citizenship in 2021.

99.title: Star Sports bags Cricket Australia media rights for next 4-yr cycle: Reports
99.article_body: Star Sports has reportedly bagged the media rights to broadcast Australian cricket in India for the upcoming four-year cycle. Cricket Australia and the sports broadcaster are reported to have signed the contract, which includes a clause to extend the arrangement by an additional four years. The cycle will likely begin from the start of this year's Australian cricket season.

100.title: Will use entire police reserve if needed: Anil Vij on catching DSP's killers
100.article_body: After Tauru DSP was allegedly killed by a mining mafia in Haryana's Nuh district, state Home Minister Anil Vij said, "Every single one of them (accused) will be apprehended." "I told the DGP that a reply to this incident will be given, even if he has to use police force of the entire district, nearby districts or reserve," Vij added.

101.title: COVID-19 cases triple across Europe, hospitalisations double: WHO
101.article_body: The World Health Organization has said that COVID-19 cases have tripled across Europe in the past six weeks. "Hospitalisation rates...have doubled in the same period," it added. The 53 nations in WHO's European region reported nearly 3 million new cases last week, accounting for nearly half of all infections globally. Reportedly, Europe is seeing about 3,000 coronavirus-related deaths every week.

102.title: Seeking money for 'ailing' mom, man cheats Pune BJP MLA of ₹3,400
102.article_body: A case has been registered against a man for allegedly cheating a BJP MLA from Pune of ₹3,400 by claiming that he needed money to buy medicines for his ailing mother, police said on Tuesday. Madhuri Misal said that she received a call, following which she asked her daughter to transfer the money to the given number.

103.title: K'taka govt to oppose Centre's draft notification on ESA in Western Ghats
103.article_body: Karnataka government has decided to oppose Centre's draft notification on Ecologically Sensitive Areas (ESA) in the Western Ghats. Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said, "MLAs cutting across party lines have unanimously expressed their opposition to the notification...A delegation of Lok Sabha members and MLAs...headed by CM (Basavaraj Bommai), will meet the Union Environment Minister."

104.title: Japan fisherman stabs over 30 sea turtles to death in 'frustration'
104.article_body: A Japanese fisherman has confessed to stabbing 30-50 sea turtles to death in "frustration" after they got caught in his fishing net, officials said. The sea turtles, which are protected creatures, were found with stab wounds on their necks and other body parts on a beach on Kumejima island last week. The fisherman, who hasn't been named, expressed regret later.

105.title: No: MoS Rai as MP asks whether terror attacks are rising in India
105.article_body: After Lok Sabha MP A Ganeshamurthi asked whether incidents of terror attacks are rising in India, Union Minister of State (MoS) for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai replied, "No, Sir." The MoS said, "The security situation has improved significantly in Jammu and Kashmir...There has been a substantial decline in terrorist attacks from 417 in 2018 to 229 in 2021."

106.title: Fire breaks out at residential building in East Delhi; 12 rescued
106.article_body: A fire broke out at a four-storey residential building in East Delhi's New Ashok Nagar on Tuesday, officials said. Delhi Fire Service Director Atul Garg said, "Five fire tenders were rushed to the spot and so far 12 people have been rescued." The fire broke out on the building's first floor and the incident's cause is being ascertained, Garg added.

107.title: Haryana CM announces ₹1 cr aid for DSP killed by mining mafia, vows strict action
107.article_body: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar announced financial assistance of ₹1 crore for the family of DSP Surender Singh, who was allegedly killed by the mining mafia in Nuh on Tuesday. Khattar also announced a government job for one of Singh's family members. The CM said he has directed authorities to take the strictest possible action against the accused.

108.title: Not nailed yet: Marnus Labuschagne on his ODI spot for 2023 World Cup
108.article_body: Marnus Labuschagne has said he's targeting to be part of Australia's squad for the 2023 ODI World Cup. He, however, also stated that he's yet to nail down a spot in the XI. "I certainly haven't been performing as well as I want to," he added. Labuschagne has played 21 ODIs, scoring 677 runs, including one century and four fifties.

109.title: Olympic champion Rojas wins third straight triple jump World C'ships gold
109.article_body: Olympic gold medallist Yulimar Rojas of Venezuela won her third consecutive triple jump gold at the World Athletics Championships after she jumped 15.47 metres in Oregon on Monday. "This is a special competition for me," said Rojas. Jamaican Shanieka Ricketts clinched her second consecutive world silver with a 14.89-metre jump, while American Tori Franklin took bronze (14.72 metres).

110.title: He was retiring this yr, has 2 kids: Brother of Haryana DSP killed amid mining raid
110.article_body: The younger brother of Haryana DSP Surender Singh, who was run over by a truck during an illegal mining raid, has said the officer was due for retirement this year. "I spoke with him today only," said Singh's brother Ashok Manju, adding, "He has two children." Singh was on a surprise inspection based on a tip-off, said ADG Ravi Kiran.

111.title: After Carmel Convent mishap, survey says 72 Chandigarh dry trees need felling
111.article_body: After Carmel Convent school incident in Chandigarh, a fresh survey of 204 schools has found that 72 dead and dry trees need felling. UT Adviser Dharam Pal has given a week to municipal corporation and UT Engineering and Forest Departments to cut these trees down. This comes after a student lost her life after tree fell on her in city.

112.title: 5-month pregnant woman given abortion pill by husband in UP, dies
112.article_body: A five-month pregnant woman from Uttar Pradesh's Auraiya district died after her husband gave her an abortion pill. The 27-year-old woman's parents alleged that she started bleeding excessively after consuming the medicine. Her relatives then took her to a hospital where she was declared brought dead. The woman's parents have demanded action against her husband and his family.

113.title: UP man impersonates Bombay HC CJ, tries to cheat officers; held
113.article_body: A 34-year-old man has been arrested from UP for allegedly impersonating the Chief Justice of Bombay HC Dipankar Datta and trying to cheat court officers. The police said that the accused had set Justice Datta's name and photo as a display picture on WhatsApp and sent out messages to officers demanding Amazon Pay gift cards.

114.title: Bus overturns in UP after driver tries to avoid hitting stray animal; 1 dead
114.article_body: A Kanpur-Meerut bound bus overturned near Harchandpur village in Etah, Uttar Pradesh, leading to the death of one person, Jaswant (45), and injuring 18 people, including 5 women. The bus met with an accident after the driver lost control while trying to avoid hitting the stray animal that came in front of the vehicle, police said.

115.title: B'luru woman tears down illegal hoarding wishing BJP leader on birthday
115.article_body: A woman tore down an illegal flex hoarding installed to wish BJP national general secretary CT Ravi on his birthday in front of Vidhana Soudha in Bengaluru on Monday. Social media chief of Congress' Karnataka unit from Belagavi shared a video online in which the woman is seen ripping the poster. "Bindu Gowda boldly tore down the banner," he wrote.

116.title: Sri Lankans protest outside house of ex-Prez Rajapaksa's son in US
116.article_body: A group of Sri Lankan protesters gathered outside house of ex-Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's son Manoj in Los Angeles and demanded that Rajapaksa returns to Sri Lanka. The protest that took place last week comes amid ongoing economic crisis in Sri Lanka. Gotabaya, who has resigned as President, is currently in Singapore on a "private visit", Singapore government said.

117.title: Picasso sketch worth over ₹3.6 cr seized by Spanish customs
117.article_body: Spanish customs officials at Ibiza Airport seized a Picasso sketch worth over €450,000 (over ₹3.6 crore) after a traveller failed to declare the artwork. The unnamed passenger, who arrived from Switzerland, initially attempted to pass the 1966 sketch, named Trois personnages, as a copy. But a gallery invoice discovered in his luggage appeared to identify the work as an original.

118.title: Shehnaaz Gill to join Anil, Bhumi in Rhea Kapoor's next: Reports
118.article_body: Shehnaaz Gill has reportedly signed on to star in Rhea Kapoor's next film. It'll reportedly be helmed by Rhea's husband Karan Boolani. She'll be seen sharing screen space with Anil Kapoor and Bhumi Pednekar in the forthcoming project, reports said. The film is reportedly a modern take on relationships and will go on floors by the end of this month.

119.title: Delhi govt received 3,500 missed calls to volunteer as 'Paryavaran Mitra'
119.article_body: The Delhi government received 3,500 missed calls from those who want to be registered as 'Paryavaran Mitra', an official statement said on Tuesday. 'Paryavaran Mitra' is an initiative to build a network of people who can work for environmental sustainability. The volunteers will be responsible for increasing greenery, reducing pollution and improving waste management in their areas.

120.title: Body of missing 7-yr-old from Thane found, relative says family is devastated
120.article_body: Body of seven-year-old boy who had fallen in Thane creek last Wednesday has been found in Airoli. "His father used to go by the creek side every morning and wait for some news from the boats that went looking for Rishi. Rishi's mother is still hoping that he would be back healthy...the news...left...family devastated," said a relative of the family.

121.title: Two feared dead after being swept in river in Rajasthan's Pratapgarh
121.article_body: Two men are feared to be dead after they were swept by the strong currents of the Mahi Erav river in the Bawdi village of Rajasthan's Pratapgarh district. The incident happened when the two missing persons, Jeta Delia (25) and Rajeng Singh (22), along with two others were trying to cross the river, the Station House Officer (Ghantali) said.

122.title: Manushi joins John in 'Tehran', says 'This is going to be really special'
122.article_body: Manushi Chhillar has been roped in to star opposite John Abraham in the upcoming film 'Tehran'. The former Miss World, who was recently seen in Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj', shared a post on Instagram announcing her next film and wrote, "Super excited to join the one & only John Abraham on #Tehran. This journey is going to be really special!"

123.title: SRK has been working to build toned physique for 4 yrs: Trainer on Pathaan
123.article_body: Discussing actor Shah Rukh Khan's toned physique for 'Pathaan', his trainer Prashant Sawant said SRK has been working towards this physique for the last four years. "Everything in diet was...measured...Despite injuries serving as a setback, he came back stronger," added Prashant. "Shah Rukh started doing a lot of [heavy lifting]...Previously, we used to do...circuit training," he stated.

124.title: Government does not maintain data of arrested journalists: MHA
124.article_body: Union Minister for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai, on Tuesday, informed in a written reply in Lok Sabha that the NCRB does not maintain any specific data regarding the arrest of journalists. His remarks came after TMC MP Mala Roy had asked about the total number of journalists arrested in the country since 2019, along with the charges against them.

125.title: Funeral procession of Haryana's law & order taken out: Hooda on DSP's killing
125.article_body: Congress MP Deepender Singh Hooda reacted to the killing of Tauru DSP Surender Singh in Nuh on Tuesday. "Funeral procession of Haryana's law and order has been taken out," Hooda added. "The state government has completely failed and criminals are roaming around-both mining mafia and organised gangsters. Organised crime has entered Haryana," Hooda stated.

126.title: Received proposal to change name of West Bengal to Bangla: MHA
126.article_body: Ministry of Home Affairs on Tuesday said the Centre has received a proposal from state government to change the name of West Bengal to Bangla. "A proposal has been received from the Government of West Bengal for renaming the state as Bangla in all three languages - Bengali, English and Hindi," Union MoS for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai, said.

127.title: Servant held for stealing gold worth ₹16 lakh from a Mumbai apartment
127.article_body: A 28-year-old servant, Chhotu Laxman Mandal, was arrested for allegedly stealing gold biscuits worth over ₹16 lakh from an apartment in Mumbai's Grant Road, police said. "The theft had taken place a week ago on July 11, when the...employer was visiting her son, who had met with an accident," police said. An FIR was registered under IPC section 381(theft).

128.title: Highways within 100 km of LoC, borders will not need green nod: Centre
128.article_body: Centre exempted highway projects related to defence and strategic importance within 100 kilometres of the Line of Control (LoC) and borders from seeking a green nod. "Such projects are sensitive in nature...need to be executed on priority keeping in view strategic...security considerations," the Centre added. It also exempted projects pertaining to the expansion of terminal buildings at airports.

129.title: KGF's Yash, wife Radhika's debut film completes 14 yrs, actress shares post
129.article_body: Actress Radhika Pandit, wife of 'KGF' actor Yash, has shared a post on Instagram celebrating 14 years of the film 'Moggina Manasu', which marked her and Yash's debut in the film industry. Sharing a few stills from the film, Radhika wrote, "This film has given me so much...A Filmfare award, State award and a life partner...couldn't have asked for more!!"

130.title: Tejashwi offered support to protect family from going to jail: Bihar BJP chief
130.article_body: Bihar BJP chief Sanjay Jaiswal said RJD's Tejashwi Yadav was ready to support BJP in government formation in Bihar to "protect himself and his family from going to jail". His statement came after Yadav said MoS Home Nityanand Rai had expressed his desire to join RJD. "No matter how much they try, Tejashwi and family will be jailed," Jaiswal added.

131.title: Govt putting more tax burden on people: Siddaramaiah on GST hike
131.article_body: Criticising the Central government over the latest hike of Goods and Services Tax (GST) on various essential food items, Congress leader Siddaramaiah said the government is putting more tax burden on people instead of helping them. "Depriving people of their food is 'Acche Din' for Narendra Modi-led government," Siddaramaiah tweeted. He further termed GST as 'Gabbar Singh Tax'.

132.title: KL Rahul faces Jhulan Goswami in nets at NCA, video goes viral
132.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Indian men's cricket team batter KL Rahul facing India Women pacer Jhulan Goswami in the nets at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru. Rahul has started net practice days after undergoing a successful groin surgery in Germany. Rahul has been included in Team India's T20I squad for West Indies series subject to fitness.

133.title: 1 labourer dead, 18 missing near Indo-China border In Arunachal
133.article_body: One labourer has died and 18 others have gone missing along the Indo-China border in Arunachal Pradesh's Kurung Kumey, District Deputy Commissioner Bengia Nighee has confirmed. Most of the 19 labourers, who went missing since July 5 from a construction site of a road project, were from Assam, Nighee added. The deceased's body was found in a nearby river.

134.title: Chinese authorities break into homes to look for COVID contacts, apologise
134.article_body: Authorities in southern China have apologised for breaking into the homes of people who had been taken to a COVID-19 quarantine hotel. Officials in Guangzhou reportedly broke into 84 homes to check for hidden close contacts and to disinfect the premises. The doors of the houses were later sealed and new locks were installed, as per the local media.

135.title: Funds slashed for Jamia & AMU, raised for BHU: Govt in Parliament
135.article_body: Funds allocated to Jamia Millia Islamia were reduced by ₹68.73 crore and Aligarh Muslim University by ₹306 crore in FY 2021-22 as compared to the previous fiscal, the government said in Parliament. According to MoS Education Subhas Sarkar, Banaras Hindu University was allocated ₹1,303.01 crore in FY 2021-22, almost double from ₹669.51 crore in FY 2014-15.

136.title: Rishabh Pant can be the future captain after Rohit Sharma: Arun Lal
136.article_body: Ex-India batter Arun Lal has said wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant can be Team India's future captain after Rohit Sharma. "He (Pant) is someone who is not afraid to play his game, can handle pressure well, can take the team out of tough situations and such a player can be a great leader," added Lal. Currently, Pant leads Delhi Capitals in IPL.

137.title: Cow urine will be used to make medicines in Chhattisgarh: CM Baghel
137.article_body: Soon after the announcement that Chhattisgarh government will purchase cow urine at ₹4 per litre, CM Bhupesh Baghel said that cow urine will be used to make medicines in the state to promote organic farming. "Our government is directly putting money in the pockets of people while Centre is taking money out of the pockets," Baghel added.

138.title: 3 arrested for stealing ₹12.2 crore from a private bank in Thane
138.article_body: Three persons were arrested for allegedly stealing ₹12.20 crore from a private bank in Thane, an official said on Tuesday. The police recovered ₹5.80 crore out of the stolen cash and property worth ₹10 lakh from the accused, Senior Police Inspector Anil Honrao stated. The police is looking for the main accused and others involved in the crime, Honrao added.

139.title: Manoj Bajpayee approached for role of police officer in Pushpa 2: Reports
139.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee has been reportedly approached to play the role of a police officer in 'Pushpa: The Rule', which is a sequel to Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa'. Actor Vijay Sethupathi has also been reportedly approached to play an important role, having opted out of the first part due to date issues. 'Pushpa' featured Fahadh Faasil in a police officer's role.

140.title: Hardik is India's most valuable player in white-ball cricket: Aakash
140.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said all-rounder Hardik Pandya is currently Team India's most valuable player in white-ball cricket. "If Hardik is fit, his replacement is not available...The team has asked more, he has delivered more. So this has been an extremely beautiful thing," stated Aakash. Hardik picked four wickets and then scored 71 runs in the final ODI against England.

141.title: 2 men cheat 68-yr-old Mumbai man of ₹22 lakh by borrowing phone to play games
141.article_body: A retired BEST employee, Parkash Naik (68), was defrauded of over ₹22 lakh by two men after they allegedly transferred the money by borrowing Naik's mobile on the pretext of playing games. The accused, Shubham and Amar, were arrested after transferring the money to multiple accounts via UPI, police said. Notably, Naik filed the complaint at the Dindoshi Police Station.

142.title: Army personnel entitled to disability pension if it's attributable to service: SC
142.article_body: Army personnel will be entitled to disability pension only if the disability is attributed to military service or was aggravated by such service and if such condition is more than 20%, the Supreme Court said. The bench was hearing an appeal filed by the government challenging an order of the Armed Forces Tribunal which granted disability pension to army personnel.

143.title: Summer Olympics 2028 in Los Angeles to be held from July 14-30
143.article_body: The opening ceremony of the Summer Olympics 2028 in Los Angeles will be held on July 14 while the Games will conclude on July 30, organiser LA28 announced. The Los Angeles 2028 Paralympic Games will start on August 15 and close on August 27. Notably, the Paralympic Games will be hosted by Los Angeles for the first time ever.

144.title: Facebook Co-founder Saverin's B Capital raises $250 mn for 1st venture fund
144.article_body: B Capital Group, an investment firm run by Facebook Co-founder Eduardo Saverin, raised $250 million for its first early-stage venture fund. The firm already has over $6 billion in assets under management. B Capital Chairman Howard Morgan said the firm plans to invest up to $2 million in seed rounds and $6-8 million in Series A rounds.

145.title: International child pornography racket busted in Gujarat, 1 arrested
145.article_body: The Gujarat Police on Tuesday claimed to have busted an international child pornography racket being run from the state's capital Gandhinagar. Police also arrested one accused in the case who confessed to running four international WhatsApp groups having members from countries like Russia and France. Around 600 photos and 224 videos were recovered from the arrested accused, police said.

146.title: Kids swim in MP school's campus as it floods after heavy rains; video viral
146.article_body: A video of students swimming in a government school's campus as it floods and "turns into a pool" amid heavy rains in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni has gone viral. A school staffer apparently took the video of the children, who'd been playing football before they started swimming. A person reportedly reacted to it, saying, "Aapda Me Avsar (opportunity in disaster)".

147.title: I'd pay for his funeral, jokes Akshay on what he'll do if Chris Rock makes fun of Twinkle
147.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar, during his appearance on Koffee With Karan season 7, was asked how he would react if comedian Chris Rock made a joke about his wife Twinkle Khanna. "I would pay for his funeral," Akshay jokingly replied. Chris Rock was slapped by Will Smith at Oscars for making a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett Smith.

148.title: Who are now the world's 10 richest people as Adani becomes 4th richest?
148.article_body: Gautam Adani has overtaken Bill Gates to become the world's fourth richest person with a $114 billion fortune, said Forbes. Elon Musk is the world's richest with $230 billion wealth, followed by Bernard Arnault ($148 billion) and Jeff Bezos ($139 billion). Larry Ellison, Warren Buffett, and Larry Page rank 6th, 7th and 8th on the world's 10 richest people list.

149.title: Man runs & gropes burqa-clad woman from behind on Pak street; video leads to outrage
149.article_body: A video of a man groping a burqa-clad woman from behind in broad daylight on a street in Pakistan's Islamabad has led to outrage in the country. The video shows the man running and attacking the woman. Responding to the video shared by a journalist, police assured action against the unidentified accused.

150.title: K'taka allows govt colleges to use student fees for development works
150.article_body: Karnataka government has allowed prescribed fees collected from students in 430 government first-grade, 91 polytechnic and 14 engineering colleges to be used for the development of the respective institutions. "The government aims to give financial autonomy to educational institutions...the respective institutions should be allowed to arrange their resources smoothly," an official order reads.

151.title: Arunachal court rejects bail plea of BJP MLA who is accused of rape
151.article_body: A court in Arunachal Pradesh on Monday rejected the anticipatory bail plea of BJP MLA from Koloriang, Lokam Tassar, who is accused of raping a pregnant woman at his residence. State CM Pema Khandu said that BJP will take action against Tassar if the allegations are proven to be true, adding, "No one is above...law." Tassar has been evading arrest.

152.title: K'taka makes hoisting Tricolour must in madrasas from Aug 11 to 17
152.article_body: The Karnataka government has made it compulsory for the madrasas in the state to hoist the national flag for six days from August 11 to 17 to celebrate 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav'. The order will also apply to other educational institutions, both government and private. Teachers and non-teaching staff have been directed to hoist the Tricolour at their residences.

153.title: US will bear consequences of Pelosi's visit to Taiwan: China
153.article_body: China's Foreign Ministry on Tuesday said that US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan would seriously undermine China's sovereignty and territorial integrity. The US would have to bear the consequences of the visit, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian said. This comes after the Financial Times reported that Pelosi was planning to visit China-claimed Taiwan in August.

154.title: Flipkart's Cleartrip suffers data breach, no sensitive info compromised
154.article_body: Global online travel company Cleartrip suffered a data breach on Monday, according to the company's email to its customers. "There has been a security anomaly that entailed illegal and unauthorised access to a part of Cleartrip's internal systems," the email read. While some personal details were a part of the leak, no sensitive information was compromised, the Flipkart-owned firm said.

155.title: Pak man who entered India to kill Nupur Sharma detained in Raj, 11-inch knife seized
155.article_body: A Pakistani national was detained in Rajasthan after he crossed the International Border to allegedly kill suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma. An 11-inch long knife, religious books, clothes and sand were found in the bag of the man identified as Rizwan Ashraf, a senior BSF officer said. He was held on Saturday (July 16) near the Hindumalkot border outpost.

156.title: Anil charged ₹10 cr for 'JugJugg...', Kiara charged ₹3 cr: Report
156.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor charged ₹10 crore for 'JugJugg Jeeyo', according to a report. Meanwhile, Neetu Kapoor, director Raj Mehta and Kiara Advani together charged ₹12 crore, with ₹4 crore going to Neetu, ₹5 crore to Raj and ₹3 crore to Kiara, report said. Varun Dhawan reportedly worked on profit-sharing basis. The film has earned ₹83.12 crore in India so far.

157.title: 65-yr-old man blackmails, rapes neighbour for 26 yrs in Mumbai; arrested
157.article_body: A 65-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping and blackmailing his former neighbour for 26 years in Mumbai. The accused threatened to show photos and videos of the first time he raped the woman to her sons, assaulted her repeatedly and extorted ₹5-6 lakh from her. She approached police when he demanded to get her daughter-in-law to sleep with him.

158.title: Woman, her 7-yr-old daughter die after house collapses in Amravati
158.article_body: A 35-year-old woman and her seven-year-old daughter were killed and three other family members sustained injuries after their house collapsed in Maharashtra's Amravati on Tuesday. An official said the old house might have collapsed due to heavy rainfall in the region.The three family members were rescued from under the debris by their neighbours and other people, the official added.

159.title: B'luru boy secures All India Rank 2 in ICSE Class 10; declared K'taka topper
159.article_body: Adi Kishore, a student of Bengaluru's Trio World School, has been declared the all-India second rank holder and the topper in Karnataka in the 2022 ICSE Class 10 examinations. Adi has scored 99.60% overall –  498 out of total 500 marks. "The teachers at Trio were incredibly supportive...when you enjoy your learning, you get rewarded in your performance," he said.

160.title: I would love to bowl against Virat Kohli again: James Anderson
160.article_body: Veteran England pacer James Anderson has said he would like to bowl against Virat Kohli again in the future. "So, maybe I will stick around for next tour, he added. Anderson bowled against Kohli in the rescheduled fifth Test in Edgbaston earlier this month. The 39-year-old picked a five-wicket haul in India's first innings.

161.title: Don't know why Pant was criticised, give him wings and he'll fly: Gough
161.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant, ex-England pacer Darren Gough said, "I don't know why he was criticised. You can tell he is a gifted cricketer. This guy, give him wings and he will fly." "It is a no-brainer that he will score runs," added Gough. Pant scored an unbeaten 125 off 113 balls in the third ODI against England.

162.title: Supreme Court grants protection from arrest to Nupur Sharma till August 10
162.article_body: The Supreme Court granted interim relief to suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma against whom multiple FIRs were filed for her remark on Prophet Muhammad. The apex court granted protection from arrest to Nupur and directed no coercive action should be taken against her till next hearing on August 10. Nupur had moved the court seeking clubbing of FIRs against her.

163.title: Seen my sister work really hard, I'll screw up anyone who trolls her: Janhvi
163.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor in an interview spoke about her sister Khushi Kapoor who'll make her debut in Zoya Akhtar's 'The Archies'. "I've seen...[her] work...really hard...She wanted this so badly, I'm just so happy for her," she said. Janhvi further said she'll not entertain any sort of trolling towards Khushi, adding, "If anyone says anything bad about her...I'm gonna screw them up."

164.title: Didn't tell family: Goldstein on playing Hercules in 'Thor: Love & Thunder'
164.article_body: Actor Brett Goldstein revealed that he did not tell his family that he was playing Zeus' son Hercules in the Chris Hemsworth-starrer 'Thor: Love and Thunder'. "They put a chip in me that would explode if I f**king spoke about it. It was terrifying," he stated. Goldstein's character is introduced in the mid-credits scene of the MCU film.

165.title: Running away from discussion on price rise, GST hike unparliamentary: Rahul
165.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised the central government over price rise, hike in GST and depreciating value of the rupee. "Running away from discussion and questions in Parliament is most 'unparliamentary', Prime Minister ji," Rahul tweeted in Hindi. The former Congress President was referring to a list of unparliamentary words released by the Lok Sabha Secretariat last week.

166.title: Will help build a strong, united India: Alva after filing nomination
166.article_body: Shortly after filing nomination papers for VP elections to be held on August 6, Opposition candidate Margaret Alva said that she will help in building a strong and united India. "I have spent my life fulfilling my commitments, with integrity and courage. Elections don't frighten me - winning and losing is a part of life," she said.

167.title: Camping, water sports banned near river banks in Himachal's Mandi
167.article_body: The tourism department and administration of Himachal Pradesh's Mandi district issued an order to ban all water sports activities and shut down all camping sites in Mandi on Tuesday. Due to the rainy season, all camping and sports activities near rivers will remain restricted till the season's end, Additional District Magistrate (ADM) Ashwani Kumar said.

168.title: Man arrested from UP for killing 65-year-old woman in Pune
168.article_body: Pune Police have nabbed a 27-year-old man who escaped to UP after allegedly murdering a 65-year-old woman and robbing her valuables at her residence in Katraj last week. The accused, who's a native of Prayagraj, had allegedly strangled the victim to death. The accused was brought back to Pune by police and has been remanded in custody till July 21.

169.title: UP worker fired for carrying PM, UP CM's photos in garbage cart reinstated
169.article_body: A sanitation worker in Uttar Pradesh's Nagar Nigam Mathura-Vrindavan, who was sacked after photographs of PM Narendra Modi and Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath were found in his garbage cart, has been reinstated. A video of the worker carrying the photos in the cart was widely shared online. He had apologised before the municipal commissioner on Monday.

170.title: Landslide hits petrol pump site in Himachal's Kangra, 6 labourers injured
170.article_body: At least six labourers were injured after a landslide hit a petrol pump site on Monday night in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra. The landslide occurred at the site where land was being excavated for the construction of a petrol pump. The labourers were admitted to a medical college in Tanda, from where one of the seriously injured was referred to Chandigarh.

171.title: List of items exempt from GST when sold loose released by Finance Minister
171.article_body: Amid criticism over pre-packaged and pre-labelled food items getting costlier after 5% GST was levied on them, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman released a list of items GST Council has exempt from GST if they are sold loose. They include pulses, wheat, rice and curd among others. "The decision is of GST Council and no one member," she clarified.

172.title: You can't play such innings if you're not responsible: Manjrekar on Pant
172.article_body: On being asked whether he was surprised by the responsibility showed by 24-year-old Rishabh Pant in the final ODI against England, Sanjay Manjrekar said, "You can't play [such] kind of innings if you are not responsible by nature." He added, "Pant was responsibility personified, he was calmness personified [in the match]." Pant scored 125*(113) to help India win the match.

173.title: Recruitment of Agniveers being done as per Army rules: Anurag Thakur
173.article_body: Reacting to Opposition's criticism regarding requirement for Agniveers to provide caste certificate during recruitment under the Agnipath scheme, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that recruitments are done as per Army Rules 1954 and Defence Service Regulation 1987.
