"Some parties like AAP try to mislead and lie. They tried to mislead youth without knowing the truth," he added.

174.title: Stabbed multiple times for watching Nupur Sharma's video, alleges Bihar man
174.article_body: A 23-year-old Bihar man alleged he was stabbed multiple times by a group of men in public for watching a video of suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma, which he had shared on WhatsApp. The man was stabbed on Friday (July 15) and is currently undergoing treatment. Two of the accused have been arrested and police are investigating the man's allegations.

175.title: Pune airport to get first-of-its-kind retail & co-working centre
175.article_body: Pune airport will get first-of-its-kind retail and co-working centre 'AeroMall' which is slated for launch in October. The centre has been developed at airport complex under public-private partnership model. "Co-working gained prominence during the pandemic...hybrid working air travellers are an obvious customer source," said Sunil Nahar, Director of Pebbles Infra-Tech, which developed the space.

176.title: Not considering any proposal to merge SAIL, Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Ltd: Govt
176.article_body: Minister of State for Steel Faggan Singh Kulaste on Monday said no proposal to merge Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL) and Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Limited (RINL) is under consideration. The government has proposed selling 100% stake in RINL along with management control by way of privatisation. The state-run steelmaker has been bearing losses for the last few years.

177.title: Sam Kerr becomes 1st female player to feature on EA's FIFA game global cover
177.article_body: Australian footballer Sam Kerr has become the first female player to feature on the global cover of the Electronics Arts' FIFA video game. Notably, this is the first such move in EA's nearly three-decade-old history. The Chelsea forward has featured alongside France's Kylian Mbappe on the cover of 'FIFA 23'. The 28-year-old footballer was WSL's top scorer last season.

178.title: Not an easy place to come, win games: Rohit on T20I, ODI series wins in Eng
178.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has said England is "not an easy place to come and win" matches following his side's 2-1 win in both the T20I and ODI series in the country. "Came here, wanted to achieve something as a group in white ball. We were here last time and were beaten, I remember that," he added.

179.title: Shiprocket acquires Arvind’s omnichannel tech firm Omuni for ₹200 cr
179.article_body: Logistics startup Shiprocket has acquired textile firm Arvind's omnichannel technology business Omuni for about ₹200 crore, Shiprocket said on Tuesday. "Transaction will be carried out as a combination of stock and cash," it added. This comes about a month after Shiprocket acquired a majority stake in logistics firm Pickrr for $200 million in a mix of equity and cash transaction.

180.title: Mumbai man's decomposed body found inside bed at home; wife missing
180.article_body: The decomposed body of a 23-year-old tailor was found inside the storage area of a bed in his rented home in Mumbai, police said, adding that his wife, who is a suspect in the case, is missing. As per reports, the couple used to fight frequently. When the man's father called his daughter-in-law, she said her husband wasn't keeping well.

181.title: Man reaches kidnapper's house with gun to rescue wife in Bihar, held
181.article_body: A man reached a kidnapper's house with a pistol and bullets to rescue his abducted wife in Bihar's Matokhar village on Saturday. Kidnapper Vikash Kumar often used to visit the couple's house. He reportedly abducted the woman when her husband, Raju, wasn't at home. The two men have been arrested under the Arms Act. No FIR was registered for kidnapping.

182.title: Woman gives birth on floor outside Delhi’s Safdarjung Hospital
182.article_body: A woman delivered her baby on the floor outside the emergency department of Delhi's Safdarjung Hospital on Tuesday morning. Her family alleged that she spent the night there after not being given access to a maternity ward or labour room. "Her papers clearly show that she was advised admission, but she did not reach the ward," a hospital spokesperson said.

183.title: Shiv Sena office-bearer attacked by unidentified persons in Nashik
183.article_body: A Shiv Sena office-bearer, identified as Nilesh alias Bala Kokane, was attacked with sharp objects by unidentified persons in the MG Road area of Nashik, Maharashtra. Kokane was rushed to a private hospital after being attacked while riding his two-wheeler, police said. The patrolling squads have combed the area to catch the unidentified attackers, police added.

184.title: Maneka writes to K'taka CM Bommai seeking probe into elephant's death
184.article_body: Lok Sabha MP Maneka Gandhi has written to Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai seeking an investigation into the electrocution of an elephant in Hassan last year. She claimed the animal was killed deliberately for its tusks. The animal rights activist further accused JD(S) MP Revanna of getting the case transferred to the forest department so that the matter could be closed.

185.title: Ex-Congress MLA arrested over ruckus on Kerala CM's flight
185.article_body: Kerala Youth Congress Vice-President and former MLA KS Sabarinadhan was arrested on Tuesday in connection with last month's protest on a flight that was also carrying CM Pinarayi Vijayan. Sabarinadhan was summoned by police based on a WhatsApp chat in which he had allegedly suggested waving black flags at Vijayan on the flight.

186.title: Man, 10-yr-old daughter die after speeding truck hits bike in Pune
186.article_body: A 35-year-old man and his 10-year-old daughter died after a speeding truck hit the bike the duo was riding on from behind in Pune on Tuesday, according to officials. The daughter, who was thrown at a distance during the accident, sustained grievous injuries and was rushed to a hospital but was declared dead on arrival, a police official said.

187.title: GHMC to conduct special drives against fast food corners in Hyderabad
187.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) is planning to conduct special drives against fast food centres in Hyderabad. The corporation has reportedly received complaints about some fast food corners adding food colouring and other harmful additives in food to improve the taste. If food quality is found to be sub-standard, the owner will be booked and fined up to ₹5 lakh.

188.title: Religious events can't hinder traffic: CM Yogi amid Kanwar Yatra
188.article_body: Amid Kanwar Yatra, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said no religious activity should be allowed to hinder traffic movement. "Roads are for people to commute. No religious programmes should be allowed to hinder the traffic," he said. "Clear directives have been issued in this regard and it should be strictly followed with zero tolerance," CM Yogi added.

189.title: No plans to develop National Employment Policy: Ministry of Labour
189.article_body: Ministry of Labour and Employment on Monday said in the Lok Sabha that there is no plan to develop the National Employment Policy and added that there is no committee for drafting the same. "However, for evidence-based policymaking, the government has launched surveys on both demand and supply side," Union Minister of State for Labour and Employment, Rameswar Teli said.

190.title: Hyderabad to witness rainfall for next 4 days: IMD
190.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted light to moderate rainfall in Hyderabad for the next four days. While the maximum temperature is expected to drop to 30°C by Saturday, the minimum temperature is likely to be around 22°C, it added. Meanwhile, the Telangana State Development Planning Society (TSDPS) predicted light to moderate rainfall across Telangana till July 21.

191.title: US kills 2 al-Shabaab militants in airstrike in Somalia
191.article_body: The US has killed two al-Shabaab terrorists in an airstrike in Somalia on Sunday, US Africa Command (AFRICOM) said. The strike was conducted in coordination with Somali government after the terrorist group "attacked partner forces in a remote location near Libikus", it added. "Violent extremist organisations like al-Shabaab present long-term threats to Somali...and US interests," it further said.

192.title: It's like salt in too much sugar: Ayan on 'love storiyaan' in 'Kesariya'
192.article_body: 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji has defended the lyrics of his film's song 'Kesariya'. Talking about the use of the words 'love storiyaan' in the song, he said, "We did not find it like elaichi [in biryani]." "We thought it was a twist like salt amid too much sugar, it has its own taste," he added.

193.title: BMC to reinstall tetrapods in Marine Drive after complaints of 'vibrations'
193.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to reinstall tetrapods back in their original location in Marine Drive after the residents complained of "unusual vibrations" during high-tide hours. The tetrapods that weigh tons were installed in late 90s to stop erosion of the coastline and few of them were reportedly removed for the ongoing Mumbai Coastal Road Project (MCRP).

194.title: Elon Musk planning to countersue Twitter over $44 billion buyout deal: Report
194.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk is planning to countersue Twitter after the company sued him for backing out of the $44 billion buyout deal, the New York Post reported. Musk has 20 days from the date of filing of Twitter's lawsuit to file his counterclaims. Twitter has accused Musk of attempting to "trash the company, disrupt its operations...and walk away".

195.title: Govt shares data showing changes in value of Indian rupee against US dollar since 2014
195.article_body: The government has shared data showing changes in the value of Indian rupee against US dollar since 2014. As per the government, the value of rupee against the US dollar has depreciated by more than 25% from December 31, 2014 to July 11, 2022. On Tuesday, the Indian rupee touched 80 per the US dollar for the first time ever.

196.title: Committee on MSP constituted by GoI comprises of BJP supporters: Raghav Chadha
196.article_body: AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Tuesday said by excluding food bowl of India, Punjab, from the newly constituted MSP committee, BJP has once again shown its "anti-Punjab" stand. "Committee on MSP constituted by GoI comprises of BJP supporters and supporters of the three black laws," Chadha added. "Can they do justice to the cause of farmers?" he tweeted.

197.title: 7 e-bikes gutted in fire while getting charged in Pune showroom
197.article_body: At least seven electric bikes were burnt after a fire broke out at a showroom in Pune on Monday night. The incident took place when the vehicles were getting charged, officials said, adding that prima facie a short circuit might have occurred due to overcharging. No one was injured in the incident.

198.title: DSP run over by truck & killed by mining mafia during raid on illegal mining in Haryana
198.article_body: A Haryana police officer was allegedly killed by a mining mafia near Nuh on Tuesday. Tauru DSP Surender Singh had reached the spot after receiving information that illegal mining was being carried out. He signalled a stone-laden truck to slow down, but the driver instead sped up and ran him over, killing him on the spot.

199.title: Ready to fight over symbol, control of party: Shiv Sena's Raut
199.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said the party was ready to fight over the symbol and control of the organisation. He added that BJP was trying to break Maharashtra into three pieces. "A few MPs and MLAs may be leaving us. But MLAs and MPs alone do not make up the Shiv Sena," Raut added.

200.title: WI's Lendl Simmons announces retirement from international cricket
200.article_body: Veteran West Indies opener Lendl Simmons has announced his retirement from international cricket aged 37. "I'm closing this chapter of international cricket having played 144 matches and scoring 3,763 runs from all formats. I want to thank the West Indies Cricket Team for the opportunities," wrote Simmons on Twitter. Simmons last played for WI in the 2021 T20 World Cup.

201.title: Courageous, admirable: Stakhovsky on Kasatkina coming out as gay
201.article_body: Reacting to Russia's top-ranked female tennis player Daria Kasatkina coming out as gay, former Ukrainian tennis player Sergiy Stakhovsky tweeted, "It takes courage." "Nothing but admiration for your freedom," he added in his tweet. "Living in the closet is impossible...Living in peace with yourself is the only thing that matters...and f**k everyone else," Kasatkina had stated.

202.title: B'luru techie drowns in river in TN's Nilgiris while taking selfie
202.article_body: A 26-year-old IT professional, working in Bengaluru, drowned while taking selfies on the banks of the Sigurhalla river in Tamil Nadu's Nilgiris district. According to police, the deceased visited Ooty with nine other colleagues and was staying in a private lodge. State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) found her body near the 20th hairpin turn at the foothills of Kalhatti slopes.

203.title: Building declared 'dangerous' 5 yrs ago collapses in Thane, 7 injured
203.article_body: A building that was declared "dangerous" almost five years ago, collapsed in Thane. The building had been emptied. However, seven people from adjacent chawl were injured in incident. The building was initially set up as a power loom unit and its first floor was meant to be residential space. Locals rushed to help after hearing a loud thud on Tuesday.

204.title: Go First Mumbai-Leh & Srinagar-Delhi flights face engine issues, grounded
204.article_body: Two flights of Go First airline, one from Mumbai to Leh and another from Srinagar to Delhi, have been grounded after facing engine glitches on Tuesday, DGCA officials said. The Mumbai-Leh flight was diverted to Delhi while the Srinagar-Delhi flight returned to Srinagar due to technical issues, the regulator said. DGCA said the aircraft can only fly after its clearance.

205.title: I miss feeling loopy but I feel really good now: Chrissy on 1 yr of sobriety
205.article_body: American model Chrissy Teigen took to Instagram on Tuesday to share a post marking one year of sobriety. "Not a drop of alcohol in 365 days! I miss feeling loopy...sometimes, but...toward the end, it didn't give that fun feeling anymore," she wrote. "I drank to end...anxiety that...mostly went away when I quit drinking! Anyhow, I feel really good," Chrissy added.

206.title: Modi ji made fall of rupee an election issue in 2014: Tharoor
206.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor criticised PM Narendra Modi-led government by holding them responsible for fall of rupee against US dollar and said, "Rupee has crossed 80. Modi Ji is the one who made it an election issue in 2014." "He was going to strengthen rupee...but then what is this strong government giving us? Even a weaker rupee," he added.

207.title: Selling public sector banks to chosen few will be disastrous: Jairam Ramesh
207.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh has said that their party will oppose the BJP-led Centre's "Bank Sale Bill". "Today, 53 years ago, banks were nationalised. Now, the Modi government is on a privatisation spree," Ramesh tweeted. "Public sector banks must be equipped to face competition, but selling them off to a chosen few will be disastrous," he added.

208.title: DNA from blood in dead mosquitoes used to catch a burglar in China
208.article_body: Police in China's Fuzhou caught a burglar after they extracted blood from two dead mosquitoes in the house he stole from and used it for DNA testing to find him. Police said the house was freshly painted and they believed that blood stains they found on its wall might be that of the suspect who had spent the night there.

209.title: Why is Delhi CM so desperate to go to Singapore: BJP to Kejriwal
209.article_body: Taking a dig at Arvind Kejriwal's complaint about pending clearance from Centre for his Singapore visit, BJP MP Manoj Tiwari said, "Why's Delhi Chief Minister who doesn't have charge of any department in the government so desperate to go to Singapore?" West Delhi BJP MP Parvesh Singh said, "It's a mayors' summit yet Kejriwal is so desperate to go there."

210.title: Fake news: China on report it invited European leaders to meet Xi
210.article_body: A Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman on Tuesday described a newspaper report saying that China had sent invitations to European leaders to meet with President Xi Jinping in November in Beijing as "fake news". Hong Kong's South China Morning Post newspaper on Monday cited an unnamed source as saying Beijing had sent invites to French, German, Spanish and Italian leaders.

211.title: Govt wants to implement TN’s medical check-up scheme across India: State minister
211.article_body: Tamil Nadu Health Minister Ma Subramanian on Monday said that seeing the success of Tamil Nadu’s door-to-door medical check-up scheme, the Centre has sought its pattern to implement it across the country. Furthermore, he said, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has asked him to present details of the scheme at the World Economic Forum scheduled in Switzerland in January.

212.title: Filmmaker Mani Ratnam hospitalised after testing positive for COVID-19
212.article_body: Filmmaker Mani Ratnam has been admitted to a private hospital in Chennai after testing positive for COVID-19. As per his wife, the 66-year-old is doing fine now. This comes days after the teaser of Ratnam's directorial 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part 1', which stars Vikram and Aishwarya, was released. Ratnam is a Padma Shri awardee and has won many National Awards.

213.title: Never been more brutal portrait of British colonisation: Piranha maker on RRR
213.article_body: Discussing 'RRR', 'Piranha' director Joe Dante said, "It's...a ridiculously melodramatic and violent...CGI fest that...[stays] continually enthralling." "I bet you've never seen anything...like it...There's [never] been a more brutal portrait of the horrors of British colonisation," added Dante. 'Doctor Strange' director Scott Derrickson had termed RRR as an awesomely outrageous roller-coaster.

214.title: Our equation is beyond cinema, we are like brothers: Sudeep on Salman
214.article_body: Actor Kiccha Sudeep, while speaking about his bond with Salman Khan, said, "We are like brothers. Our equation is beyond cinema." Salman, who is one of the presenters of Sudeep's upcoming movie 'Vikrant Rona', launched its Hindi trailer last month. Sudeep further said Salman liked 'Vikrant Rona' and "took a clean interest in the Mumbai market".

215.title: Garbage dump yard in Punjab's Amritsar turned into mini forest
215.article_body: The land at a polluted garbage dump yard in an industrial site in Punjab's Amritsar has been transformed into a mini forest. "In just three months, three acres of land at the dump yard has turned into a green forest. There are 65 varieties of trees that have been planted here," an official said.

216.title: Viral video shows huge waves crashing wedding in Hawaii
216.article_body: A video went viral showing huge waves crashing a beachside wedding reception in Hawaii. In the video, dozens of people can be seen running away as surge of water overturned tables and chairs. During an interview with a local channel, the bridegroom said no one was injured in the chaos. "Everyone will remember their wedding forever," a Twitter user commented.

217.title: Which 6 IPL teams have reportedly bought franchises in South Africa's new T20 league?
217.article_body: As per reports, six franchises of South Africa's new T20 league have been bought by IPL teams. Mumbai Indians have bought the Cape Town franchise, while Chennai Super Kings have snapped the Johannesburg franchise and Delhi Capitals have got the Pretoria franchise. Meanwhile, Lucknow Super Giants bought Durban, SunRisers Hyderabad snapped Port Elizabeth and Rajasthan Royals bought Paarl.

218.title: Gautam Adani overtakes Bill Gates to become world's 4th richest person: Forbes
218.article_body: Gautam Adani has overtaken Bill Gates to become the world's fourth richest person, according to Forbes. The development comes after the Microsoft Co-founder announced plans to donate $20 billion to his non-profit Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. Gates' net worth now stands at over $102 billion, whereas Adani Group's 60-year-old Chairman has a fortune of more than $114 billion.

219.title: I'd pay for his funeral: Akshay on if Chris Rock joked about Twinkle
219.article_body: In the promo of 'Koffee with Karan 7', host Karan Johar asked Akshay Kumar what would be his reaction if comedian Chris Rock joked about his wife Twinkle Khanna. To this, Akshay replied, "I would pay for his funeral." In March, Hollywood actor Will Smith slapped Chris at the Oscars ceremony after he made a joke about Will's wife Jada.

220.title: Man dies in Delhi's Saket over honking and parking argument
220.article_body: A 32-year-old man died after being attacked with bricks and stones by a group of six men following an argument near Saket Metro station, police said. During interrogation, it was found that the argument broke out after the driver of the car, in which the victim was travelling, blew horn to park at the place where the accused were standing.

221.title: 7 quintals of ganja worth ₹1 crore, packed in 23 sacks, seized in Jharkhand
221.article_body: Seven quintals of ganja, packed in 23 sacks, were seized from a truck in Jharkhand's Ramgarh district. Police have arrested the driver of the truck and his helper in the case. Reports said that the truck was intercepted on National Highway 33. The cost of the ganja was estimated to be about ₹1 crore, Superintendent of Police said.

222.title: Cyberabad police shares accident video, says 'Follow Stop-Look-Go'
222.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Tuesday shared a video of an accident in Madhapur and urged people to follow "Stop-Look-Go" to prevent such incidents. In the accident, an over-speeding car rammed into another car which took a right turn without observing vehicles in the opposite direction, according to traffic police. The traffic police said that the accident was non-fatal.

223.title: BJP runs away from caste census but asks for caste from Agniveers: Tejashwi
223.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has criticised the Centre for allegedly asking for caste certificate during the recruitment of Agniveers.  "The BJP government runs away from the caste-based census but asks for caste from Agniveers," Tejashwi tweeted. "The caste is being asked because the country's largest casteist organisation RSS will later sort out Agniveers on the basis of caste," he added.

224.title: Pune sees rise in dengue cases, 50 confirmed in 2 weeks
224.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has said that there has been a rise in the number of dengue cases and added that 50 cases have been confirmed in two weeks. As many as 193 confirmed dengue cases and 72 chikungunya cases have been reported from January to July. There have been no deaths due to dengue, a medical official said.

225.title: 39 trains cancelled, 58 diverted after derailed goods train blocks Guj route
225.article_body: Till 9 am on Tuesday, 39 trains were cancelled and 58 others diverted after a goods train derailed and blocked the route in Gujarat's Dahod. Reports said that the cancelled trains include some local ones, while those diverted are all express trains. The train had derailed between Mangal Mahudi and Limkheda stations.

226.title: Opposition's Vice President candidate Margaret Alva files nomination
226.article_body: Opposition's Vice President candidate Margaret Alva filed her nomination papers on Tuesday in the presence of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, NCP chief Sharad Pawar, Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge and several Opposition leaders. Alva will be contesting against NDA's candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar. "It's a tough election...but I'm not afraid," Alva had tweeted earlier.

227.title: 1 killed, 4 injured as gunmen open fire at bar in Paris
227.article_body: At least one person was killed and four others were injured after two men opened fire at individuals seated at a bar's terrace in Paris on Monday night, police said. One of the attackers has been arrested, police added. There was "no element" at this stage to "know the motivations of this barbaric act", local mayor Francois Vauglin said.

228.title: Apple shares fall on report of plans to slow hiring, spending for some teams
228.article_body: Shares of Apple fell 2% on Monday after Bloomberg reported that the iPhone maker is planning to slow hiring and limit expenditures at some of its divisions next year. The potential move would see Apple joining tech giants like Meta, Google and Tesla which have announced similar plans. Apple has 154,000 full-time equivalent employees, as per its last annual report.

229.title: List of debtors after Sanjeev Kumar's death mind-boggling: Sister-in-law
229.article_body: Actor Sanjeev Kumar's sister-in-law Jyoti Nikul Jariwala said the list of debtors after Sanjeev's death was "mind-boggling", adding that the sum was in crores of rupees. "To tell you the truth, we still haven't recovered that money," she added. "Sanjeev is the reason I'm here...Lovers of cinema will always remember each and every performance of his," Anil Kapoor had stated.

230.title: Speaker adjourns Lok Sabha till 2 pm amid sloganeering by Oppn MPs
230.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Tuesday adjourned the House till 2 pm amid sloganeering from the Opposition MPs over the issues of price hike and inflation. Moreover, before adjourning the proceedings, he said that placards aren't allowed inside the House according to the rules. An advisory issued by the Lok Sabha earlier had prohibited placards in the House.

231.title: Girl jumps off school building to escape 5 men trying to gangrape her in Odisha
231.article_body: A girl has suffered critical injuries after jumping off the roof of a school building in Odisha's Jajpur district while trying to escape gangrape attempt by five men, police said. The five accused allegedly advised her and her brother to take shelter in the school amid heavy rain and later beat up her brother and attacked her.

232.title: I thought it was a joke: Aguero on Barca announcing Messi's departure
232.article_body: Sharing his reaction to Barcelona announcing the departure of Lionel Messi in 2021, his former teammate Sergio Aguero said, "I thought someone had hacked Barca's social networks. I thought it was a joke." Discussing Messi's exit from Barcelona, ex-Barcelona striker Luis Suarez had said he was "surprised" and "suffered" with Messi. Messi is Barcelona's all-time top scorer with 672 goals.

233.title: Sri Lanka Opposition leader withdraws from Presidential race
233.article_body: Sri Lankan Opposition leader Sajith Premadasa announced on Tuesday he has dropped out of the race to become President of the crisis-hit nation. Premadasa said he is withdrawing his candidacy "for the greater good" of the country that he loves. He added that the alliance and the Opposition partners will "work hard towards making" MP Dullas Alahapperuma the winner.

234.title: Vicious cycle against Zubair: Supreme Court on multiple FIRs in UP
234.article_body: Terming the multiple FIRs against Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair a "vicious cycle", the Supreme Court on Monday ordered the UP government to not take "precipitative steps" against him until the next hearing. "What seems to be happening is as he gets bail in one case, he is remanded in another. This vicious cycle is continuing," said Justice DY Chandrachud.

235.title: Kerala minister writes to NTA over girls being told to remove bras at NEET centre
235.article_body: Kerala Higher Education Minister R Bindu has condemned the incident in which girls were allegedly told to remove their bras before entering a NEET exam hall in Kollam and said, "We've written to National Testing Agency (NTA) and the Centre expressing our disapproval of such action." "We have to ensure that a student's psychological condition is not hampered," she added.

236.title: Selfless decision by a great player: Azharuddin on Ben Stokes' retirement
236.article_body: Reacting to England Test captain Ben Stokes announcing retirement from ODI cricket, ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin said it's a "well thought" and "selfless decision by a great player". Azharuddin added, "No one listens to his body better than the player himself." Stokes announced retirement stating that playing all three formats is "unsustainable" for him.

237.title: 2 men rob people by threatening them with knife in Hyderabad, arrested
237.article_body: The Hyderabad City Police on Monday arrested two men for threatening people with a knife and robbing them of their mobile phones and cash. The duo reportedly approached the victims on a bike, threatened them with a knife used to cut coconut and robbed them. According to police, one of the accused has been involved in several past cases.

238.title: Vertical 'nap boxes' to let employees take rest during work being made in Japan
238.article_body: Two Japanese companies are collaborating to develop vertical 'nap boxes' that will allow employees to sleep while standing upright. According to the initial design, the sleeping pod will comfortably support a person's head, knees and rear so that they don't fall over. The companies are hoping to promote a healthier office culture with the 'nap box', also called 'Kamin box'.

239.title: Supreme Court transfers pleas challenging Agnipath scheme to Delhi HC
239.article_body: Supreme Court transferred three petitions challenging the Centre's Agnipath recruitment scheme to Delhi High Court. It felt "desirable and proper" to have Delhi HC's view, SC said. The petitioners said that the issue involves a pan-India problem and should be considered by SC. The court directed that all similar petitions pending in High Courts be filed as intervention applications.

240.title: Some cult films were box office duds: Swara on Taapsee's 'Shabaash Mithu'
240.article_body: A Twitter user asked actress Swara Bhasker about her thoughts after a female-driven film like Taapsee Pannu's 'Shabaash Mithu' had a low box office collection. To this, Swara replied, "I don't believe that box office earnings are the sole determinant of the value of films. Some...cult films were box office duds...some films, no better than tripe, have been hits."

241.title: Railways launches week-long 'Azadi ki Rail Gadi aur Station' celebration
241.article_body: The Ministry of Railways has announced plans to celebrate 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' from July 18-23, covering 27 trains and 75 railway stations across 24 states linked to the Indian freedom struggle. The week-long celebration will be called "Azadi ki Rail Gadi aur Station". The stations will be called "Swatantrata stations" and the trains will be called "spotlight trains".

242.title: Sushmita Sen's brother reacts to people trolling her, says 'she's a self-made woman'
242.article_body: Sushmita Sen's brother Rajeev Sen defended the actress after she was trolled over her relationship with Lalit Modi. "A lot has been said about my sister negatively regarding her current pictures with Mr Modi. I can proudly say that my sister is a self-made woman...She is a responsible mother and a role model for many Indians," Rajeev said.

243.title: Best film I've seen in a long time: Shilpa on Madhavan's Rocketry
243.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty Kundra took to her Instagram Stories to praise R Madhavan's directorial 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect', calling it "a must-watch" film. "Madhavan, so proud of you...what a film! I was an emotional wreck," she wrote. "Loved every bit #nambinarayanan sir, you are such a HERO. Best film I have seen in a long time," Shilpa further wrote.

244.title: ED has become an extended part of BJP: Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi
244.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi on Monday said the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has become an extended part of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). "Wherever the BJP is in Opposition in a state, action is taken against [leaders of] the ruling party," she added. "However, if [they] come after bathing in the Ganges of the BJP, the action...stops," she further said.

245.title: Bouncer beaten to death over parking near metro station in Delhi, 1 held
245.article_body: Police arrested a 22-year-old person after a 35-year-old bouncer was allegedly beaten to death by a group of five to six men following a quarrel over parking near Delhi's Saket Metro Station. The incident took place after the victim was returning with friends following his work at a club. The accused allegedly attacked the victim with bricks and stones.

246.title: In veiled attack, Sena's Sanjay Raut calls CM Shinde’s faction 'snakes'
246.article_body: Amid reports of Shiv Sena's MPs being in touch with Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde, party leader Sanjay Raut launched a veiled attack on Twitter at Shinde's faction. "Do not leave the forest because of the fear of snakes," he wrote. As per reports, 12 of 18 Shiv Sena's MPs are likely to join CM Shinde's camp.

247.title: Delhi Metro's Blue Line section hit by tech glitch
247.article_body: Train services between Indraprastha and Yamuna Bank stations on the Delhi Metro's Blue Line were impacted on Tuesday morning due to a technical glitch leading to a delay in service. The Blue Line connects Dwarka Sector-21 in Delhi and Electronic City in Noida with a branch at Yamuna Bank to Vaishali. The issue is yet to be rectified.

248.title: PM Modi pays tribute to Revolt of 1857 hero Mangal Pandey
248.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday paid tribute to Mangal Pandey, the hero of India's Revolt of 1857 against the British East India Company, on his birth anniversary. "The great Mangal Pandey is synonymous with courage and determination. He ignited the spark of patriotism at a very critical period of our history and inspired countless people," he tweeted.

249.title: Complaint that girls were forced to remove bras at NEET centre fictitious: Official
249.article_body: NEET exam centre superintendent in Kollam has denied the allegation of a girl's father who filed a police complaint stating that his daughter was asked to remove her bra before taking the entrance exam. The official said that the complaint is "fictitious and filed with wrong intentions". The students were allegedly asked to remove bras because of their metal hooks.

250.title: Had to deliver, so they come for more talent from India: Dhanush on Gray Man
250.article_body: Actor Dhanush has said he wasn't nervous to work with Russo Brothers in 'The Gray Man'. "I felt I'd a responsibility, now that the West is watching talents from India, I felt I'd to deliver so that they come for more talent from here," he added. Dhanush further said working with Russo Brothers was a "really simple and smooth process".

251.title: You can never rule out a player of his calibre: Karthik on Virat Kohli
251.article_body: Amid Virat Kohli's poor form, India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik has said the former India captain will come back recharged from the break he has been given and do "phenomenally well". He added, "You can never rule out a player of his calibre." Kohli has been rested for India's white-ball tour of West Indies comprising three ODIs and five T20Is.

252.title: Young couple end life on railway tracks in Rajasthan's Barmer
252.article_body: A young couple allegedly died by suicide in Rajasthan's Barmer district on Monday.  According to police, the young man aged 16 and the woman aged 23 jumped in front of a passenger train near the Mokalsar railway bridge. Police have also found a note near their bodies which read, "We both are ending our lives at our own free will."

253.title: Hardik can surpass Kapil Dev's record in white-ball cricket: Jaffer
253.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said all-rounder Hardik Pandya can definitely surpass Kapil Dev's record in white-ball cricket. "If he keeps bowling like this, (it can happen). He already has the batting capability," added Jaffer. Hardik picked six wickets in the three-match ODI series against England. He was the second highest run-getter in the ODI series, having scored 100 runs.

254.title: Still here, in our hearts: Twinkle on dad Rajesh's death anniversary
254.article_body: Actress-turned-writer Twinkle Khanna penned a note on her father Rajesh Khanna's 10th death anniversary. "10 years. He is still here. In all our hearts," she wrote. Along with the note, she shared an old picture of herself with the veteran actor. Bobby Deol, Manish Malhotra, Tisca Chopra and Tahira Kashyap reacted to Twinkle's post.

255.title: Boat carrying wedding guests capsizes in Pakistan, 20 killed
255.article_body: At least 20 people have died and several others are missing after a boat carrying more than 100 wedding guests capsized in a river in Pakistan's Punjab province on Monday, officials said. The cause of the accident is not yet known, but officials believe the boat was overcrowded. Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif expressed his grief over the incident.

256.title: Rahul Gandhi joins Oppn's protest on inflation on 2nd day of monsoon session
256.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday joined the Opposition’s protest over the issues of inflation and price rise, at the Parliament. The monsoon session of the Parliament began on Monday. "We will fight it tomorrow...We have appealed to all parties to fight against price rise and GST hike," Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said on Monday.

257.title: No state opposed 5% GST on food items at Council meet: Officials
257.article_body: No state opposed the move to bring pre-packaged commodities under GST in the 47th GST Council meeting, a senior official present in the meeting said. The Union Finance Minister is the Chairperson of the GST Council and states' Finance Ministers are its members. The rate rationalisations took place based on recommendations of a group of ministers (GoM), another official said.

258.title: Indian-founded Instacart's valuation cut by another 40% to $14.7 billion
258.article_body: American grocery delivery startup Instacart's valuation has been cut by another 40% to $14.7 billion by its investor Capital Group. The development comes months after the company slashed its valuation by about 40%, from $39 billion to $24 billion. Co-founded by Indian-origin Apoorva Mehta in 2012, Instacart confidentially filed for an IPO to go public in the US in May.

259.title: 13 men pose nude near Raj Bhavan to protest caste-based discrimination in Chhattisgarh
259.article_body: As many as 13 members of the Satnami sect staged a nude protest near Raj Bhavan in Chhattisgarh's Raipur on Monday, alleging  discrimination based on caste. The police reportedly raided the houses of the protestors as they carried out the protest without permission. "Our faith in the constitution and Indian system is shaking," a protestor said.

260.title: 7-yr-old girl asks Maha CM Shinde to take her for vacation, he says 'yes'
260.article_body: A seven-year-old girl asked Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde to take her for a vacation to Guwahati during Diwali break. CM Shinde said "yes" and added that they will visit Kamakhya Mandir, a popular temple in Nilachal Hills in Assam's Guwahati. Reports said that the girl met the Chief Minister at his Nandanvan Bungalow on Sunday evening.

261.title: SC rejects father's plea seeking stay on 2nd autopsy after TN girl student's suicide
261.article_body: Supreme Court rejected the request of the father of a class 12 girl, who allegedly died by suicide in Tamil Nadu, to put on hold the second autopsy scheduled for Tuesday. The re-postmortem was ordered by Madras High Court. Violent protests erupted in front of the 17-year-old student's school in Kallakurichi where she died by suicide, alleging torture by teachers.

262.title: Why is Parliament not debating on Ladakh border crisis?: Owaisi
262.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Monday asked, "Why is the Parliament not debating [on] the Ladakh border crisis?" "Why are my questions on Ladakh being denied in the Parliament? Why is [PM] Modi scared of truth coming out in the public? What is he hiding?" he added. "Is [PM] Modi going to take the responsibility for this failure?" Owaisi asked.

263.title: Pic captures the moment a train is stopped in middle of wildfire in Spain
263.article_body: A picture of the moment a passenger train stopping in the middle of a wildfire in Spain amid heatwave has surfaced online. The train was going from Madrid to Ferrol when it temporarily stopped due to the flame near the road, according to reports. "It was really scary to see how quickly the fire spread," a passenger said.

264.title: Nick Jonas shares pics from Priyanka's b'day, calls her 'Jewel of July'
264.article_body: Singer-actor Nick Jonas shared pictures of actress and wife Priyanka Chopra's birthday celebration on Instagram. Along with the pictures, he wrote, "Happiest birthday...the jewel of July. So honoured to be on this crazy ride called life with you. I love you." In the pictures, Nick can be seen holding a towel which read, "Priyanka! The Jewel of July, est. 1982."

265.title: Trolling is part of life today: Ranbir Kapoor on memes on 'Kesariya'
265.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has reacted to trolls and memes related to his song 'Kesariya' over the lyrics of the song. "Today, memes...trolling are all part of life and it's fine as long as people enjoy the song, Pritam's music and Arijit Singh's singing," he stated. Ranbir added, "I want them to enjoy my chemistry with Alia...that's what the endeavour is."

266.title: Untalented, parasitical: Sylvester Stallone to 'Rocky' producer Irwin
266.article_body: Sylvester Stallone took to Instagram and called 'Rocky' and 'Creed' producer Irwin Winkler "untalented and parasitical". Stallone called out the producer while reviewing his son David Winkler's book, which he called "by far the worst". As per Stallone, three more movies in the 'Rocky' franchise would have been made had Irwin not been the producer.

267.title: Auto driver booked after man whom he knocked down, left near PMC dies
267.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver has been booked after a man whom the former allegedly knocked down in a road accident and left unattended near Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) entrance died. The deceased was found dead about a month ago. Reportedly, the auto-rickshaw driver had said that he'll take the deceased to the hospital but left the latter near PMC entrance instead.

268.title: Woman, her fiancé try to extort money from aunt in Bengaluru, arrested
268.article_body: A woman and her fiancé were arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly using spy cameras to blackmail the woman's aunt over her extramarital affair. The accused, identified as K Usha and her fiancé Suresh Babu, had allegedly captured the victim's private moments on camera. They then used the clip to blackmail the victim and demanded ₹25 lakh from her, police said.

269.title: India reports 15,528 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,43,654
269.article_body: India has reported 15,528 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after India reported 16,935 new cases. The number of active COVID-19 cases now stands at 1,43,654. The COVID-19 death toll has risen to 5,25,785 after 25 persons lost their lives in the last 24 hours.

270.title: 7 arrested, including 5 women, for selling newborns in Delhi
270.article_body: Seven people, including five women, were arrested by the Delhi Police for allegedly selling newborns to childless couples. During the arrest, an infant was also rescued by the police. The accused are named Veena, Madhu, Salmi, Bablu, Barkha, Jyoti, and Pawan. Notably, an absconding Jharkhand resident would hand over infants to the accused who would then sell them, police said.

271.title: Elon Musk responds as his pics from Mykonos vacation amid Twitter lawsuit go viral
271.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk responded after he was spotted vacationing in Greece's Mykonos, amid Twitter's lawsuit against him. Replying to a viral shirtless picture of him, he wrote on Twitter, "Maybe I should take off my shirt more often...(already back in the factory btw)." Musk was joined by Endeavor CEO Ari Emanuel and his wife Sarah Staudinger in Mykonos.

272.title: 26-year-old Indian-origin man shot dead in a nightclub in Canada
272.article_body: A 26-year-old Indian-origin man, Pardeep Brar who was critically injured in a nightclub shooting in Canada's Toronto, has passed away. Police said that a 24-year-old woman was also injured in the incident, but she was released from the hospital. The information on the suspect is yet to be released by police.

273.title: T20Is are different: Gavaskar on whether Pant can replicate ODI form
273.article_body: Following Rishabh Pant's maiden ODI hundred in the third ODI against England, Sunil Gavaskar said, "We will need to wait and see (whether Pant is able to replicate this form in T20Is)." "In T20Is, you've to start playing from third gear and move into fifth gear, so it is very different from ODIs," added Gavaskar. Pant scored an unbeaten 125.

274.title: Kohli is struggling, Dhawan looks rusty, Rohit also hasn't been consistent: Jaffer
274.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said that the lack of runs from Team India top-order needs to be looked at. "Virat Kohli is struggling at the moment and Shikhar Dhawan is looking rusty. Rohit Sharma also hasn't been as consistent as we would want him to be," he stated. Kohli scored 33 runs in his two innings in England ODIs.

275.title: 220 kids who lost parents to COVID admitted to KVs: Govt tells Parliament
275.article_body: Union Ministry of Education informed the Parliament on Monday that as many as 220 children, who lost their parents to COVID-19, have been granted admission into centrally-run Kendriya Vidyalayas (KVs) under the PM CARES for Children scheme. According to data shared by the ministry, maximum admissions took place in Madhya Pradesh (68), followed by Uttar Pradesh (17) and Karnataka (16).

276.title: Elderly couple escaping wildfire in Portugal found dead in burned-out car
276.article_body: The charred bodies of an elderly couple were found inside a burned-out vehicle that crashed as they tried to escape a wildfire ripping across Portugal's northern municipality of Murça, authorities said on Monday. The couple was aged over 80. The wildfire in Murça is one of nine blazes sweeping across  Portugal, which has been battling a heatwave since last week.

277.title: Around 2 lakh pilgrims perform ongoing Amarnath Yatra till date this year
277.article_body: Nearly two lakh pilgrims have performed the ongoing Amarnath Yatra till date this year and 15,642 pilgrims had 'darshan' at the cave shrine on Monday, said officials. "Since the Yatra started on June 30 this year, 1,99,453 have performed the Yatra," Officials of Shri Amarnathji Shrine Board (SASB) said. Total 32 pilgrims lost their lives during the Yatra this year.

278.title: Lulu mall turned into political hotbed: Yogi to Lucknow admin, police
278.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday criticised the Lucknow administration and police over protests at Lulu mall, saying that it's been turned into a "political hotbed". "Miscreants...should be dealt with strictly...No one should be permitted to obstruct traffic on the road by organising prayer or other events," he added. He also told the administration to take the matter "seriously".

279.title: Allahabad HC rejects revision petition in Babri Masjid demolition case
279.article_body: Allahabad HC's Lucknow bench rejected the revision petition filed against the acquittal of all 32 accused persons in the Babri Masjid demolition case. It directed its office to convert and treat the revision as a criminal appeal. Those accused include former Deputy PM LK Advani, the then UP CM Kalyan Singh, BJP leaders Murli Manohar Joshi, Uma Bharti and others.

280.title: Took 11 hrs to complete 'Kun...', was asked do to wuzu before singing it: Javed
280.article_body: Singer Javed Ali said that it took around 11 hours to complete the song 'Kun Faya Kun'. "I vividly remember I was asked to do wuzu before singing the song, which made experience very wholesome. So, all three of us [Javed Ali, AR Rahman, Irshad Kamil] were at studio and started recording the song till the next morning," he added.

281.title: Character assassination: BJP on Tejashwi's 'Nityanand desired to join RJD' remark
281.article_body: BJP spokesperson Nikhil Anand reacted to RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav’s statement that MoS for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai had expressed his desire to join RJD. "A dyed-in-the-wool RSS man like Nityanand Rai will prefer death to any association with RJD. His rising stature is causing troubles for Tejashwi Yadav and his family, so they're indulging in character assassination," Anand said.

282.title: Treating wife like a 'cash cow' without any emotional attachment is mental cruelty: HC
282.article_body: While granting divorce to a couple, Karnataka High Court held that a husband treating his wife as a cash cow and using her money without having any emotional attachment towards her would amount to mental cruelty. The bench stated that the husband had taken ₹60 lakh from the wife on the pretext of carrying out business.

283.title: Got a big playground to play as an actor: Rao on working with Raj & DK
283.article_body: Rajkummar Rao shared his experience of working with filmmaker duo Raj and DK in upcoming web series 'Guns & Gulaabs' and said, "They are phenomenal...The quirk and humour they have are so unconventional." "I got such a big playground to play as...actor, there was so much to explore," he added. Raj and DK also directed Manoj Bajpayee-starrer 'The Family Man'.

284.title: Chhattisgarh to start purchasing cow urine at ₹4/litre from July 28
284.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister's Office (CMO) has announced that the state government will begin the purchase of cow urine at the proposed minimum rate of ₹4 per litre from the festival of 'Hareli Tihar' on July 28. In the first phase, the cow urine will be procured from two independent 'gauthans' in each of the state's districts, the CMO said.

285.title: Downey Jr has always been someone I've looked to for guidance: Evans
285.article_body: Actor Chris Evans, while speaking about his 'Avengers' co-star Robert Downey Jr, said, "Downey and I'd been through together at a time in my career where I was still uncertain, still feeling things out, trying to take on a pretty big role." "So, he's always been someone I've looked to for guidance and who better could you ask?" Evans added.

286.title: People are 'still surprised' about women understanding cricket: Saiyami
286.article_body: Actress Saiyami Kher said she finds it "strange" that people are still surprised about a woman loving and understanding cricket or other sports. "People find it difficult to accept women watching [a] sport or (playing it) as they are still stuck in a stereotypical world," added Saiyami. "The reality is different...This dated mentality needs to change," she stated.

287.title: Flight tickets under name 'Mr Ballot Box' bought for Presidential poll ballot boxes
287.article_body: As the voting for the Presidential election concluded on Monday, ballot boxes were sent to Delhi from different states. Earlier, the Election Commission of India sent ballot boxes to 14 states/UTs for the Presidential polls, and separate 'two way' air tickets were booked for the boxes under the name 'Mr Ballot box', a picture of which has surfaced online.

288.title: Delhi govt to conduct door-to-door survey in Aug for issuing e-health cards
288.article_body: The Delhi government is expected to start a door-to-door survey this August for creating a health database for its e-health cards and health information management system (HIMS), health officials said. The department aims to distribute the cards in November or December, they added. This information will help Delhi government hospitals to record and track each patient's medical history.

289.title: Irked by poor roads, Thane man carries mud & gravel in car, fills potholes
289.article_body: Irked by the poor condition of roads, Sangam Dongre, a 42-year-old resident of Thane, got out of his car with some placards, protested against the potholes and started filling them on Monday. "I travel...[regularly] from Naupada to Shahapur...poor condition of roads has made travel very difficult. Hence, I carried a sack of mud and gravel...to cover this stretch," he said.

290.title: Mumbai to receive low rainfall for next 10 days: Skymet
290.article_body: A private forecaster, Skymet Weather Services, has predicted that for the next 8-10 days the rain intensity in Mumbai will be low as there are no significant weather systems for heavy rainfall around the city. However, subdued monsoon activities will continue, the weather forecaster added. On Monday, Mumbai's temperature increased 3.8 degrees Celsius compared to Friday.

291.title: Nude protest against caste-based discrimination staged near Raj Bhavan in Raipur
291.article_body: Members of the Satnami sect staged a nude protest near Governor House in Chhattisgarh's Raipur on Monday, alleging that discrimination based on caste has not ended yet. The protest was reportedly carried out without permission and police raided residences and other locations of the protestors. Around half a dozen agitators were detained by the police for staging demonstrations, reports said.

292.title: Man seen doing pushups on moving truck falls in UP, police shares pics of injuries
292.article_body: Lucknow ADCP Shweta Srivastava shared a video of a shirtless man doing pushups on a moving truck. He could be seen falling off the truck in the end. Sharing pictures of his injuries, Srivastava said, "He was trying to be 'Shaktiman', but now won't be able to sit for a few days! WARNING: Please don't do such deadly stunts!"

293.title: I would bowl leg-spin as I'm a big fan of Anil Kumble: S Sreesanth
293.article_body: Ex-Indian cricketer S Sreesanth said he started off as a leg-spinner as he is a "very big" fan of Anil Kumble, adding that he also tried to copy Shane Warne. Discussing his decision to become a pacer, Sreesanth stated, "Tinu Yohannan played for India so I thought if he can play for India...then I need to be a fast bowler."

294.title: Haryana Congress MLA resigns over threat calls; withdraws it later
294.article_body: Congress MLA from Haryana's Sonipat, Surender Panwar, resigned from Vidhan Sabha. However, he withdrew his resignation letter five days later after an assurance from Assembly Speaker Gian Chand Gupta. Panwar claimed that he received a threat call from Dubai and the caller had demanded a ransom from him. "The Speaker assured me and all other MLAs complete protection," he said.

295.title: Teenage girl saves mother from being stabbed to death by stepfather in Delhi
295.article_body: A 15-year-old girl saved her mother, Saraswati Barman, from getting stabbed to death by her stepfather, Gajan Barman, in Delhi's Govindpuri area. The girl managed to stop Gajan, not before he had stabbed Saraswati a few times, by pushing and punching him, police said. Saraswati was rushed to a hospital by the police. Notably, Gajan allegedly ill-treated her stepdaughter.

296.title: Reliance Jio submits highest deposit of ₹14,000 crore for 5G spectrum auction
296.article_body: Reliance Jio Infocomm submitted the highest earnest money deposit of ₹14,000 crore for upcoming 5G spectrum auction, as per the Department of Telecommunications data. Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea have deposited ₹5,500 crore and ₹2,200 crore as earnest money, respectively. Meanwhile, Adani Data Networks, which earlier said it has no plans to enter consumer mobility segment, deposited ₹100 crore.

297.title: Not necessary for Bihar farmers to migrate to other states for jobs: Tikait
297.article_body: BKU leader Rakesh Tikait has said that the farmers of Bihar should come forward for their rights and raise their voices. "It is not necessary for the farmers of Bihar to migrate to other states for jobs," he added. "If any farmer would get a genuine price for the crops, why would he go to other states?" Tikait asked.

298.title: Beggary Act will be strictly enforced in K'taka: Social Welfare Minister
298.article_body: Karnataka's Social Welfare and Backward Classes Welfare Minister Kota Shrinivas Poojari on Monday said the government would strictly enforce the Karnataka Prohibition of Beggary Act, 1975, in the state to end begging. Poojari said, "101 children...involved in begging have...been taken into custody." He added that a case will be registered against those who leave children on streets for begging.

299.title: Delhi man sends morphed pics, videos of woman to her in-laws; arrested
299.article_body: A man, who hails from Delhi's Tughlakabad, was arrested for allegedly sending morphed nude photos and obscene videos of a woman to her husband and in-laws on Instagram. The 22-year-old woman had recently got married. According to police, there was a marriage proposal to her from the accused's family, but due to his criminal background, it was turned down.

300.title: mCaffeine announces Buy 1 Get 1 Free offer during its Big BOGO Days
300.article_body: Natural and 100% Vegan brand mCaffeine has announced its Buy 1 Get 1 Free offer starting July 19, adding that it's even bigger this time as 5 lucky winners stand a chance to win iPhone 13. Launched in 2016, the brand offers caffeinated skin and hair care product range. Users can use code BOGO at checkout to avail the offer.

301.title: It's time for David Warner's leadership ban to end: Greg Chappell
301.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Greg Chappell has said it's time for the leadership ban imposed on David Warner to end. "He obviously had a central role in what happened but he was not the only one...I don't know why he should be treated any differently," said Chappell. The ban was imposed on Warner for his role in the 2018 ball-tampering scandal.

302.title: Court upholds Ansal brothers' conviction in 1997 Uphaar cinema fire case
302.article_body: A Delhi court upheld the conviction of Sushil Ansal and Gopal Ansal over tampering with evidence in the 1997 Uphaar cinema fire case. It acquitted one co-accused, Anup Singh, in the case and granted him bail. A magisterial court had earlier convicted and awarded seven years in jail to the Ansal brothers, along with a fine of ₹2.25 crore each.

303.title: Boris Johnson takes video selfie while flying in Typhoon fighter jet
303.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson took a selfie video while flying in Typhoon fighter jet, days after he announced his resignation from the post. He was offered a go on the £75 million RAF plane while visiting a Lincolnshire base. In the video, he could be seen giving a thumbs up, while two other planes jet alongside.

304.title: His voice brought joy to millions: Ajay Devgn on singer Bhupinder Singh
304.article_body: Reacting to the demise of veteran singer Bhupinder Singh, Ajay Devgn has said, "His voice brought joy to millions and had a uniqueness." "Deeply saddened about the demise of Bhupinder ji...Condolences to his family," he added. The singer, known for songs like 'Naam Gum Jayega' and 'Honthon Mein Aisi Baat', passed away of colon ailment at the age of 82.

305.title: India's richest woman Savitri Jindal's fortune rose by $12 billion in two years: Forbes
305.article_body: India's richest woman Savitri Jindal witnessed her fortune rise by $12 billion in the last two years, according to Forbes. Jindal's net worth stood at $4.8 billion in 2020 and it has surged to $17.7 billion this year. The 72-year-old is the head of the OP Jindal Group, founded by her late husband Om Prakash Jindal in 1952.

306.title: 'Want to cast all my family in a film, call it nepotism', jokes Janhvi
306.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has said she hasn't been able to meet other family members due to their respective busy schedules. "The only way now to get the family together is to just do a film...like cast everyone in the family," she jokingly stated. "Maybe we'll have to call it nepotism only because it's all in the family," she added.

307.title: Getting 1800s train was impossible, created 400-foot train: Shamshera director
307.article_body: 'Shamshera' director Karan Malhotra said they created a 400-foot train for action sequence in the movie. "One...larger-than-life action sequence happens on a train. There were challenges because getting a train from the 1800s wasn't possible," he said, adding, "We were clear...that whatever we did, it had to look like it was from the era that the film was set in."

308.title: $18mn worth of elephant tusks, other animal parts seized in Malaysia
308.article_body: Malaysian authorities have seized nearly $18 million of wildlife contraband, their biggest seizure to date. The Customs Department said it discovered the contraband hidden behind sawn timber following checks on a ship on July 10. The shipment included 6,000 kg of elephant tusks, 100 kg of pangolin scales and 25 kg of rhino horns. The shipment reportedly arrived from Africa.

309.title: Before becoming Minister, Nityanand expressed desire to join RJD: Tejashwi
309.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav claimed that Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai had come with a request to be taken into RJD when he had not become a minister. Tejashwi said this after Rai criticised him for his "murti" remark against NDA Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. Rai had "no moral courage" to react, Tejashwi said.

310.title: Rupee hits 80 per US dollar for the first time ever
310.article_body: The Indian rupee touched 80 per US dollar for the first time ever on Tuesday after opening at 79.99 per dollar. The rupee declined for the eighth consecutive session after crude oil surged on concerns about tighter supplies globally. At the time of writing, rupee was trading at 80.01 per dollar, after touching a fresh record low of 80.02.

311.title: Not going to be scared of anyone: Oppn's VP candidate Margaret Alva
311.article_body: Margaret Alva, the Opposition’s candidate for Vice President elections, on Monday said in politics, winning or losing is not the issue, fighting the battle is. "I will file the nomination tomorrow and will fight their (NDA's) campaign…I am not going to be scared of anyone," she added. Jagdeep Dhankhar, BJP-led NDA’s nominee for Vice President, filed nomination papers on Monday.

312.title: Not Tests, but future of ODIs looks uncertain: Ojha after Stokes' retirement
312.article_body: After England all-rounder Ben Stokes announced retirement from ODIs, ex-India cricketer Pragyan Ojha said, "We were worried about the Test cricket's future but the future of ODIs looks uncertain!" He added, "We may see many cricketers preferring to move away from this format." Stokes announced retirement stating that playing all three formats is "just unsustainable" for him.

313.title: I don't put limitations on myself: Sudeep on breaking language barrier
313.article_body: Actor Kiccha Sudeep said he doesn't put limitations on himself by sitting in a pre-conceived notion that he can do this and he can't do this. "If [the project] excites me, I just go ahead," he added. Sudeep stated, "I'd continue to do films for my directors...writers of my...state, also for all those...who write for me in other industries."

314.title: Hardik, Pant can form a pair like Yuvraj, MS Dhoni were: Gavaskar
314.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said Hardik Pandya and Rishabh Pant can "definitely" form a pair similar to Yuvraj Singh and MS Dhoni. "Both had the ability to hit huge sixes and...ran well between wickets," added Gavaskar. Hardik and Pant stitched a partnership of 133 runs off 115 balls in the third ODI against England which India won by five wickets.

315.title: Police arrests nephew for murder of former BBMP corporator's husband
315.article_body: Days after former BBMP corporator Nazima Khan's husband was stabbed to death in Bengaluru, the police arrested his nephew in the case. Mateen Khan, who allegedly killed his uncle on July 13, was arrested from Kengeri on July 17, said Deputy Commissioner of Police (West) Laxman B Nimbargi. Mateen had reportedly killed Ayub Khan over the presidentship of a mosque.

316.title: Pune Municipal Corporation invests ₹800 crore in govt securities
316.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has invested almost ₹800 crore in government securities till date, according to Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar. The civic body's Chief Accounts and Finance Officer Ulka Kalaskar said that this was done to get maximum returns as "fixed deposit interest rates [have] declined". The move is "completely safe" and supported by the Centre and RBI, she added.

317.title: My father was a big bully, he used to test his directors: Ranbir
317.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said that his late actor-father Rishi Kapoor was a "big bully", adding that he used to "test his directors". "If he comes on too strong and...director doesn't hold his own and agrees to everything he says, he knows he has to take over the project," Ranbir added. "So he always did this testing thing," said Ranbir.

318.title: Delhi govt to train women as commercial drivers, to bear 50% cost
318.article_body: In a bid to recruit more women into the public transport network, Delhi government in collaboration with app-based aggregators will train about 1,000 women to become professional drivers. Women trained under this initiative would receive guaranteed jobs in these companies, the government said. Notably, 50% of the training cost for each woman (around  ₹4,800) will be borne by the government.

319.title: B'luru to get flyover linking Outer Ring Road & West of Chord Road
319.article_body: The foundation stone of a new flyover that will connect the Outer Ring Road and West of Chord Road towards Kurubarahalli Pipeline Road in Bengaluru was laid on Sunday. The half-kilometre flyover is expected to help decongest traffic. It will be constructed at a cost of ₹5.5 crore, said State's Urban Development Minister Byrathi Basavaraja.

320.title: BMC forcibly evicts residents from 7 'dangerous' buildings in Mumbai
320.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) forcibly evicted occupants from seven buildings located in Juhu-Vile Parle ward, which were declared unfit for habitation. The civic body had to take this step as the occupants refused to vacate the buildings even after their water and electricity supply were disconnected. Last month, a building in Kurla collapsed, leading to death of 19 residents.

321.title: B'luru commuters decry auto-rickshaw woes, say apps not reliable
321.article_body: Several people in Bengaluru have expressed concerns about the high auto-rickshaw fares in the city, saying the daily commute has become a major challenge for them. "The auto drivers in the city stopped using their fare meter long time ago," said a student. An IT employee said even app-based services like Ola and Uber are unreliable.

322.title: Bomb squad searches Mumbai area after hoax call from jobless, drunk cook
322.article_body: The bomb detection and disposal squad of the Mumbai Police searched the Mahalaxmi Race Course area of Mumbai after a cook, in drunk condition, informed the control room that bombs are going to be planted in the area. It was later found to be a hoax call. Reports said the cook had lost his job one day ago.

323.title: Rishi Sunak tops 3rd round of voting for new UK PM, only 4 remain in race
323.article_body: UK's ex-Finance Minister Rishi Sunak on Monday won the most votes in the third round of voting to succeed Boris Johnson as UK PM. Sunak received 115 votes, ahead of Trade Minister Penny Mordaunt (82 votes), Foreign Secretary Liz Truss (71 votes) and ex-Equalities Minister Kemi Badenoch (58 votes). These four candidates will enter fourth round of voting on Tuesday.

324.title: Will veto Sweden, Finland's NATO bids if promises not kept: Turkey
324.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Monday warned that Turkey will veto the NATO membership bids of Sweden and Finland if they fail to keep their promises of extraditing individuals with alleged terror links. Erdogan said that he believes Sweden is "not showing a good image" for now. Sweden and Finland had agreed to consider Turkey's extradition requests last month.

325.title: Govt shares meme on fake post on 'liquor pipeline' connection at home, says 'chill guys'
325.article_body: Stating that a viral post claiming that people can apply for a "liquor pipeline" at their homes is fake, the government said, "Chill guys, Don't get your hopes too high." It also shared a picture of Nana Patekar from the movie 'Welcome', which has "control..." written in caption. The viral fake post demanded ₹11,000 from connection.

326.title: Pune records coolest maximum temperature in July since 2012
326.article_body: Amid heavy rains on most days in July, Pune recorded the highest day temperature at 30°C on July 3 and July 4, which is the coolest maximum temperature recorded in July since 2012. The all-time record for the warmest day in Pune in July was in 1966 when the highest maximum temperature reported was 36°C.

327.title: Mairaj Khan creates history, becomes 1st Indian to win men's skeet gold at ISSF World Cup
327.article_body: Indian shooter Mairaj Ahmed Khan on Monday created history by winning the country's first-ever ISSF World Cup gold medal in men's skeet. In the 40-shot final, the 46-year-old from Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh shot 37 to finish ahead of Korea's Minsu Kim (36) and Britain's Ben Llewellin (26).

328.title: Pant reacts to Yuvraj's '45-minute conversation made sense' tweet, says 'It did, indeed'
328.article_body: After former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh praised Rishabh Pant for scoring his maiden hundred and said that their 45-minute conversation made sense, the 24-year-old Team India wicketkeeper responded to Yuvraj's tweet. He wrote, "It did, indeed Yuvi pa." Pant scored 125*(113) to help India defeat England in the ODI series decider.

329.title: Russia's top-ranked female tennis player Daria Kasatkina comes out as gay, shares pics
329.article_body: Russia's top-ranked female tennis player Daria Kasatkina, in a recent interview, came out as gay. "Living in the closet is impossible. [It's] not for the long run...Living in peace with yourself is the only thing that matters...and f**k everyone else," she said. She later shared a picture of herself with her girlfriend Natalia Zabiiako, who's an Olympic medal-winning pair skater.

330.title: Twitter accuses Musk of 'slow-walking' trial, says 'it is harming us each day'
330.article_body: Twitter has accused the world's richest person Elon Musk of trying to "slow walk" the company's lawsuit against him for backing out of the $44-billion deal. "Millions of Twitter shares trade daily under a cloud of Musk-created doubt...This very public dispute harms Twitter with each passing day," Twitter said, urging the judge to hold a trial at earliest possible date.

331.title: 2 teachers booked for forcing girl students to remove uniforms near Delhi
331.article_body: At least two teachers of a government school were booked for allegedly forcing two Dalit girl students to remove their uniforms in Hapur near Delhi, police said. The teachers were taking photographs of students in school dress and two girls were allegedly asked to remove their uniforms and give them to two other girls who were not in school dress.

332.title: Live organs transported in 23 mins via green corridor in Hyderabad
332.article_body: Rachakonda and Hyderabad Traffic Police provided a green corridor for the transportation of live organs, heart and lungs, from Kamineni Hospitals in LB Nagar to Apollo 24x7 in Jubilee Hills, police said. The organs covered a distance of 21 km in 23 minutes during the transportation, police added. Rachakonda Police Commissioner commended the Rachakonda Traffic Police's service, police further said.

333.title: Dad Boney couldn't try acting as he was focused on brothers: Janhvi
333.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has revealed her father and producer Boney Kapoor could have tried acting if he didn't have the pressure of his father's business and his brothers' acting careers. "After work, he used to watch old music videos and act it out...I remember mom (Sridevi) would be like, 'I'm...glad...you didn't become an actor, you'll be so vain'," she added.

334.title: No force, 15 yrs of change happened in 2 yrs: Sudeep on South films in North
334.article_body: While talking about films from South working in North, actor Kiccha Sudeep said it "hasn't been forced". "It's high time we got theatrical releases...which we are now...It was bound to happen but what has happened in these two years is almost 15 years of change," he said, adding, "If I give you what you haven't seen...you will be interested."

335.title: 4 people shot at nightclub in Spain, suspected attacker stabbed
335.article_body: Four people were shot and one other was stabbed with a knife at a nightclub in the Spanish town of Marbella, police said on Monday. The person who was stabbed is suspected to be the one who opened fire, police added. Police informed that two of the four people who were shot and the suspect were in serious condition.

336.title: India and Fiji hold 5th Foreign Office Consultations in Suva
336.article_body: Delegations from India and Fiji held the fifth Foreign Office Consultations on Monday in Suva during which the entire gamut of bilateral relations between the countries was reviewed, the Indian High Commission in Suva said. The two sides also discussed ways to strengthen bilateral ties, the mission added. It further informed that the Indian delegation met senior Fijian cabinet ministers.

337.title: J&K LG announces 10% reservation for 'Agniveers' in police
337.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha on Sunday announced a 10% reservation in the UT's police force for those who retire after serving in the military under the Agnipath scheme, PTI reported. Sinha said that his decision was influenced by the suggestion of two youths from Jammu. He further directed state officials to ensure that aspiring 'Agniveers' get the resources they need.

338.title: Terror hideout busted by security forces in J&K's Ramban district
338.article_body: Security forces busted a terror hideout and seized a cache of ammunition and explosives in J&K's Ramban district on Monday, officials informed. The hideout was detected during a joint search operation by the Rashtriya Rifles and the police, officials added. According to officials, a grenade, 35 AK rounds, explosive material and seven pistol rounds were among the items seized.

339.title: Goa reports 100% voter turnout in Presidential polls
339.article_body: All 40 eligible members of the Goa Legislative Assembly, including CM Pramod Sawant, voted in the Presidential elections on Monday. The polling started at 10 am and all 40 MLAs had voted by 1:50 pm, Secretary of the Goa Legislative Assembly Namrata Ulman said. She added that the polling was conducted smoothly and no complaints or objections were raised.

340.title: Yasin Malik to go on hunger strike if 'fair trial' demand not met
340.article_body: Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik said that he will go on hunger strike from July 22 if his demands for a fair trial are not met, the Jammu and Kashmir Liberation Front (JKLF) stated. Malik moved an application to the Centre seeking personal appearance in two cases. He is currently serving a life sentence in a terror funding case.

341.title: Report claims Ronaldo to join Sporting CP as car seen at stadium, he calls it 'fake'
341.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo has branded reports of a return to Sporting CP on loan as 'fake'. Reports had emerged from Portugal on Sunday claiming the Manchester United forward was at Sporting CP's Jose Alvalade Stadium to discuss a loan return to his boyhood club. A report had also included a picture of Ronaldo's car in the stadium.

342.title: Bajrang Dal activist attacked in Uttar Pradesh
342.article_body: A Bajrang Dal activist, Prashant Saini, was attacked in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur district by unidentified miscreants, the police said. Saini was on his way to pick up his son from school when he was attacked by five-six men, Additional Superintendent of Police Rajesh Kumar said. The activist was rushed to the hospital while an FIR was registered against the attackers.

343.title: Male model, friend arrested with cannabis worth ₹1cr; supplied drugs in DU campus
343.article_body: A 25-year-old Delhi-based model named Shubham Malhotra and his 27-year-old friend Kriti have been arrested with premium quality 'charas' (cannabis) worth ₹1 crore. The duo allegedly supplied drugs to youngsters around the Delhi University (DU) campus. They were allegedly procuring 'charas' from Himachal Pradesh's Malana and transporting it to Delhi hidden in a pillow in their car.

344.title: 2-time Olympic champion Crouser wins 1st shot put world gold in US sweep
344.article_body: Two-time Olympic gold medallist and world record holder Ryan Crouser won his first gold medal at World Athletics Championships in Oregon on Sunday as he led a US clean sweep with a championship record throw of 22.94 metres. Defending champion Joe Kovacs threw 22.89 metres to clinch silver, while Josh Awotunde won bronze with a personal best of 22.29 metres.

345.title: CBI arrests 8 persons for alleged malpractices in NEET UG 2022 exam
345.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) arrested eight people on Monday for alleged malpractices in NEET UG 2022 exam held on July 17. The CBI claimed that candidates' user IDs and passwords were collected by the accused, who made necessary modifications to get desired examination centres. The accused also tried to morph photographs to facilitate use of proxy candidates.

346.title: If I get 20 minutes with Virat Kohli, I might be able to help him: Sunil Gavaskar
346.article_body: Amid Virat Kohli's poor form, Sunil Gavaskar said, "If I had about 20 minutes with him...I'd...tell him the things he might've to do. It might help him." He added, "Having been an opening batter...having been troubled by [off-stump] line...there are certain things that you try and do. If I get 20 minutes...I might be able to tell him."

347.title: Zoho to hire 2,000 people as it looks to expand globally
347.article_body: Software-as-a-service (SaaS) startup Zoho is planning to hire 2,000 people across various roles in engineering, design, content and sales as it looks to expand its operations in India and globally. Speaking to Economic Times, Prashant Ganti, head of products, tax, accounting and payroll at Zoho, said that the company plans to grow organically and expand to other geographies.

348.title: iVOOMi Energy to set up Electric Vehicle manufacturing unit in Pune
